215 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 mai 2022
Initially, I thought this would be a fun simulation of sorts that puts your problem-solving skills to a test by putting you into a situation where you're facing a perilious hazard like running out of oxygen or overheating or finding a leak... but the game is just so incredibly tedious and repititive on top of being flat out frustrating that I can't find it in me to play any more of this.

You hop into an escape pod and for the longest time, nothing happens which is boring as heck. Suddenly, EVERYTHING happens. The oxygen isn't working. The monitor is broken. The components you brought with you are useless. The whole ship is gonna break down before you get rescued in time.
The game isn't impossible. I survived one or two rescues, actually,... but it's so dependant on pure luck that it gets annoying really quickly. You will need to find certain components that are in their own spots and then you'll need to hope that you won't face anything that requires components you don't have. Alternatively, you may dismantle the components you got and possible use that to your advantage but most of the time, you can't just repair things... You need to do specific things via trial and error... and it's just annoying.

Like, you can try this game out and hop into one of the challenges or rescue scenarios but most of the time, the game struggles to actually start the run correctly or it gets incredibly boring for the longest time. One of my runs, nothing happened for seven minutes, and then the oxygen didn't work correctly for a little while but I got rescued on minute 10, just barely, after not being able to do anything. Where's the fun in that? I survived... not because I did anything... I survived because I got good RNG and because I didn't quit to the desktop out of boredom.

Oh, but the game is also incredibly bad designed in other ways. You may look at this and go: "Oh, this error? Let me look through the manual for it!" but time is running low and the manual is little help overall. It's a huge red herring. The devs probably want you to join the sandbox mode and essentially just memorize the manual or try out every fix possible. Most of the time, you're better off just quitting the game if you run into something that you can't fix - not because of your enjoyment but because of your sanity as the game keeps beeping and buzzing and making so many annoying sounds that it's a surprise that the reviews overall are very positive. I wonder if people just turn off the sounds while playing this to enjoy it at all.

Game's had potential but honestly, not recommended in its current state.
 
MagiWasTaken

IrishFBall32

5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 3 aout 2023
ğ•Šğ•¡ğ•’ğ•”ğ•–ğ•”ğ•£ğ•’ğ•—ğ•¥ ğ•¤ğ•šğ•ğ•¦ğ•ğ•’ğ•¥ğ• ğ•£, ğ•¨ğ•šğ•¥ğ•™ ğ•’ğ•Ÿ ğ•’ğ•”ğ•¥ğ•¦ğ•’ğ•ğ•ğ•ª ğ•§ğ•–ğ•£ğ•ª "ğ••ğ• ğ•¨ğ•Ÿ-ğ•¥ğ• -ğ•–ğ•’ğ•£ğ•¥ğ•™" ğ•˜ğ•’ğ•ğ•–ğ•¡ğ•ğ•’ğ•ª, ğ•¤ğ•–ğ•– ğ•¨ğ•™ğ•’ğ•¥ ğ•€ ğ••ğ•šğ•• ğ•¥ğ•™ğ•–ğ•£ğ•–? ğ•ğ• ğ•

Okay, so you've had this fantasy since your childhood, being able to actually ride a spacecraft to space and being in total control of your probable impending doom... Tin Can wants nothing more than to fulfill that dream of yours.

Tin Can's entrance is very... laborious; you're, right at the start of the game, just overwhelmed and completely swarmed with tasks to perform... Get oxygen to produce properly, get CO2 to release properly, get lights on this ship, monitor incoming asteroids... absolutely bombarded, and at first you'll feel like this is not for you (I know I did), it was too complex for my tiny 30 year old brain to comprehend... However, after an hour in Ranked mode (which is basically an endless survival mode), I started getting the hang of it.

Your ship relies heavily on your ability to maneuver around the pod and the most troublesome part is that sometimes, parts of certain machines blow up and you'd have to replace them... to do that you'd have to scrap some "dead" ones for TIN, that allows you to repair your blown up fuses and whatnot. In a situation where you're attacked by asteroids, aliens, exploding stars and suffocating black holes all at once, you may lose it and commit some very ridiculous mistakes... but I believe in a couple of hours, you'd be ready, young astronaut.

All in all, I really enjoyed the couple of hours this game lasted... it's one of the GOOD cans humble bundle throws at you. 8/10 would die due to lack of oxygen again.
 
Fauxnel

ç½èˆ±é€ƒç”ŸæŒ‡å— Tin Canè¯„æµ‹
ç»è¿‡ä¸€æ®µæ—¶é—´çš„EAï¼Œè¯¥ä½œç»ˆäºæ¨å‡ºäº†å®Œæ•´ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶ä¹Ÿæœ‰äº†ä¸­æ–‡ï¼Œå¯¹äºä¹‹å‰å› ä¸ºå…¨è‹±æ–‡æ‰‹å†Œè€ŒåŠé€€çš„ç©å®¶æ¥è¯´æ˜¯å›å‘çš„æœ€å¥½æ—¶åˆ»ã€‚
ç”Ÿå­˜æ¨¡æ‹Ÿç±»æ¸¸æˆï¼Œåœ°ç‚¹ä¸ºå¤ªç©ºï¼Œç©å®¶éœ€è¦åº”å¯¹è‡ªå·±é€ƒç”Ÿèˆ±å†…å‘ç”Ÿçš„ç§ç§é—®é¢˜ï¼Œè¿›è¡Œè§£å†³ã€‚è¿™ç§é¢˜æçš„æ¸¸æˆï¼Œå¿…é¡»è¦æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªæ— æ³•å¯¹æŠ—çš„å¤–éƒ¨ç¯å¢ƒï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªéšç€æ—¶é—´å››å¤„æ¼é£çš„åº‡æŠ¤æ‰€ã€‚æ ¸æˆ˜ã€ä¸§å°¸ã€å¤ªç©ºï¼Œç¡¬æ ¸çš„ã€é­”å¹»çš„ï¼Œç›¸äº’ç»„åˆä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œéƒ½æœ‰ä¸å°‘è¯¥ç±»é¢˜æçš„æ¸¸æˆã€‚æ¯«æ— ç–‘é—®ï¼Œè¯¥ä½œå°±æ˜¯å±äºç¡¬æ ¸å¤ªç©ºé¢˜æä¸‹çš„ç”Ÿå­˜æ¸¸æˆï¼Œå½“ç„¶è¿™ç±»æ¸¸æˆæˆ–å¤šæˆ–å°‘è‚¯å®šä¼šæœ‰èµ„æºç®¡ç†çš„éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæœ‰ç‚¹åƒ60Sï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯ç¾éš¾æˆ–è€…è½¬æŠ˜äº‹ä»¶å‘ç”Ÿå‰æœ‰ä¸€æ®µæ—¶é—´ä¾›ç©å®¶æœç½—ç‰©å“ã€‚
è¯¥ä½œç¡¬æ ¸çš„éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæ˜¯ç”±äºå¤ªç©ºä¸­ç§ç§å¤–ç•Œå› ç´ ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚é»‘æ´ã€å°è¡Œæ˜Ÿã€ç”µç£é£æš´ç­‰ç­‰å¯¹äºèˆ°ä½“æˆ–å¤šæˆ–å°‘æœ‰ä¸å°‘å½±å“ã€‚å€’æ˜¯ç»™ç©å®¶çš„æŒ‡å¼•è¿˜è¡Œï¼Œä½†ä¹Ÿåªé™äºæ–°æ‰‹æ—¶çš„å¸®åŠ©ï¼Œè¿‡äº†æ–°æ‰‹æœŸéƒ½è¦é ç©å®¶è‡ªå·±æ¥è¿›è¡Œæ“ä½œã€‚è™½ç„¶è¯´æœ‰é€ƒç”ŸæŒ‡å—å¯ä»¥ä¾›ç©å®¶æŸ¥è¯¢ï¼Œä½†å®é™…æ“ä½œä¸‹æ¥è®©ç©å®¶æ‰‹å¿™è„šä¹±çš„å¤šå°‘æœ‰ç‚¹å¿ƒçƒ¦ã€‚å®è´¨ä¸Šå°±æ˜¯ç”¨å·²æœ‰çš„èµ„æºå»å¼¥è¡¥åˆ«å¤„çš„ç©ºæ´ï¼Œå½“èµ„æºè€—å°½ï¼Œå°±åªèƒ½æ‹†è¥¿å¢™è¡¥ä¸œå¢™ï¼Œæœ€åè¿æ¥ç”Ÿå‘½çš„ç»ˆç„‰ã€‚
å¤šä¸ªæ¨¡å¼ï¼Œå¯¹äºä¸åŒçš„ç©å®¶æ¥è¯´éƒ½æœ‰å„è‡ªçš„é€‰æ‹©ï¼Œå½“ç„¶å¤§å®¶éƒ½æƒ³æŒ‘æˆ˜æœ‰å¤©æ¢¯æ’åçš„ç¡¬æ ¸æ¨¡å¼ï¼Œä½†å®é™…æ“ä½œå‡ºæ¥è¿˜æ˜¯å¾ˆæƒ³çŸ¥é“é‚£äº›å¤§ä½¬å¦‚ä½•ç”Ÿå­˜è¿™ä¹ˆä¹…ã€‚VRæ¨¡å¼ï¼Œä½†ä¸æ˜¯åˆšéœ€ï¼Œä½†VRä¸‹æ“ä½œåº”è¯¥æ›´èº«ä¸´å…¶å¢ƒäº›ã€‚

raceway
1,815 produits enregistrÃ©s

2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
22.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 mai 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Claustrophobia looms large as panic sets in. Something impacts the mere inches of protective hull outside, it sounds like rain. There's a hissing sound. Alarms begin to beep, your chest tightens and it's getting hard to see.

The lights go out. But something is flickering...
Is that... Smoke... That you smell?

Tin Can is an excellent Space-Survival-Horror game that locks you inside of exactly that! A Tin Can. More specifically, a (sometimes) shoddy escape pod hurtling at great speeds through space and (sometimes) without the parts needed to fix it.

With no towels or volleyballs in sight, can you survive... The Tin Can?

RecommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 mai 2022
A must try puzzle game ! Better to figure things out on your own, it's very satisfying to finally make your Can work. Game lacks a bit of diversity in its missions and the campain is a bit on the easy side, but hopefully a TinCan2 can include longer scenarios, bigger ships and space travel, etc...

Given its length, I believe it's a bit overpriced, but Challenges and Ranking (survival mod) give it a high replayability.

I went ahead and took the plunge. It is intense, keeps you on the edge wanting to reach that next minute despite the catastrophes that lay waiting. You hope the parts you have will last long enough or you are ingenious enough to make them last. Very positive!

At the start of the escape pod its fun but then it starts to get to a point where there is to much to repair. This is part of the game but its still annoying.

suggestions:
- add a minigame with an arm or something where you can grab more parts from crashed escape pods so you can last forever.
- make items slowly deteriorate esp in very hot or cold environments.
- allow main computer to turn on or off systems (I actually haven't tried this so it may work)
- add an option to remove error codes and always use error names

RecommandÃ©
3.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 31 octobre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

A great little indie game concept that puts you in the boots of possibly Jebediah Kerman from KSP, on a space mission gone wrong. You are on an escape capsule and try to survive as long as possible by keeping the necessary systems working.

Un bon petit jeu, realisÃ© par un studio d'une seulle personne. Le concept du jeu est comme s'il s'agissait d'une aventure failli des Kerbals, et vous etÃªs possiblement au lieu de Jebediah Kerman. Vous etÃªs dans une capsule de sauvetage, et votre seul but est de survivre en maintenant les sous-sytÃ¨mes necessaires.
 
Warbringer
0
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1
RecommandÃ©
5.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 mai 2022
Never before has a game grabbed me like this. It is HARD, this game will take your family hold them hostage and beat you with your own shoe, but it is extremely rewarding once you get through. Nothing compares to when you half your systems are damaged, broken, etc. and you are frantically trying to fix everything, manage your atmos and temp, keep the reactor running, and you see the rescue is but less than a minute away. I cannot recommend this game enough.

If you are worried about replayability: don't This game has a set of "main" missions of increasing length of survival incrementing by 5 mins, starting at 5, and ending at 30, beating each one of these unlocks a different part of the ship, from batteries, to O2 recycler, to repairs, and finally the computer system. This doesn't make your game easier btw, these systems help in many ways, but they are also more systems for you to track and maintain. You can create your own scenarios, edit how long you need to survive for, and there is a endless mode, and a bonus "tin can" if you will.

If you are looking for a game that makes you feel like you are a scrappy surviver trying to survive in space with a rust bucket of a tin can constantly correcting failing systems, etc. This is your game.
 
Anewchallenge

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

A space based crisis manager, sort of like Keep Talking and No One Explodes with black holes and fiery suns. Pretty RNG based with what components you lose and what you have to juggle during the events to try to stay alive, but quite fun in those regards. Eventually you can remember the more important codes and can drop the main computer to give yourself a boost in parts at the start.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 dÃ©cembre 2022
extremely anxiety inducing, and for me, not in the fun way. seems to want you to try over and over again based on the apparently random items your pod will start without, leaving you unable to operate certain components of your pod so.... if it was something really vital (like the on switch for your main computer), you might as well restart. i am very bored of wait-to-die sims. the camera shake and background noise were also really annoying the whole time. maybe i'm a huge dumb baby who wants my hand held through everything but the tutorial (the only part where i could tell what the heck was going on) was my favorite part.
 
poopmonster420
281 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
11 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 dÃ©cembre 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

If you're buying for VR, DON'T- at least until 2023.
(THIS IS A VR REVIEW, NOT OF BASE GAME)

The most basic functions in order to call this a full VR game are immensely broken. With the accidental push of a button (which happens all the time on a vive TOUCH PAD, where CLICKING the same pad are different necessary buttons) you're teleported right out of the ship, and any attempt to get back inside just re-teleports outside (there are no options to turn off teleportation or locomotion functions. In this really trapped limbo phase where you're outside of the ship, any movement to the outter shell of the ship walls causes components to push out and/or break completely from the outside (becoming lodged or non-functional once you get back in). I died 8/10 times from mechanically faulty VR scripting and poorly programmed boundary collisions. This feels rushed for a VR audience cash grab, and now I'm stuck with a title that I really want to play- but just can't because of development.

DO NOT BUY FOR VR

æ¸¸æˆç»™æˆ‘çš„æ„Ÿè§‰æœ‰ç‚¹åƒå¤ªç©ºæ‰‹åŠ¨ç‰ˆçš„60sï¼Œæœ€å¼€å§‹éƒ½æ˜¯æ‰‹å¿™è„šä¹±çš„æ¡åƒåœ¾æ—¶é—´ï¼Œçœ‹è§ä»€ä¹ˆéƒ½æƒ³è¦ï¼Œä»€ä¹ˆéƒ½èˆä¸å¾—ä¸¢ï¼Œç„¶è€Œç©äº†åŠå¤©æ‰å‘ç°æˆ‘çœŸæ˜¯æ¡äº†ä¸€å †æ²¡ç”¨çš„åƒåœ¾ã€‚ä¸è¿‡åœ¨æ¸¸æˆæ­£å¼å¼€å§‹åï¼Œæ¯”èµ·åªéœ€è¦é€‰æ‹©--ç­‰å¾…çš„60sï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰æ´»åŠ¨éƒ½éœ€è¦ç©å®¶äº²åŠ›äº²ä¸ºåŠ¨æ‰‹å®æ“ï¼Œä¸è¿‡å·§çš„æ˜¯æˆ‘å‘ç°æˆ‘ä»€ä¹ˆéƒ½ä¸ä¼š...è¿™æ—¶å€™æˆ‘æ‰æƒ³èµ·æˆ‘è²Œä¼¼è·³äº†æ•™ç¨‹ç›´æ¥ä¸Šæ‰‹æ¥ç€ï¼Œçœ‹æ¥è·³è¿‡æ•™ç¨‹çœŸçš„ä¸æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¥½ä¹ æƒ¯ã€‚è™½ç„¶æˆ‘å’Œæ¸¸æˆä¸­çš„ä¸»è§’éƒ½å¤„äºä¸€è„¸æ‡µé€¼çš„çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘ä¾æ—§å¯ä»¥è‡ªè±ªåœ°è¯´å‡ºæ¸¸æˆçš„ä¸»è¦å†…å®¹å°±æ˜¯è§£å†³åœ¨ä½ çš„æ˜Ÿé™…æµæµªæ—…é€”ä¸­é‡åˆ°çš„å„ç§é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå…¶å®è¿˜æ˜¯å¾ˆé€‚åˆé‚£äº›ç†å·¥ç©å®¶çš„ã€‚

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
1
RecommandÃ©
26.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 mai 2022
At the end of my long scramble for survival in ranked mode, I was floating weightlessly in a dark coffin, trying in vain to understand why my life support systems weren't doing what they were supposed to. Were the pumps damaged? Bad data connectors? Had I just forgotten to turn the main generator back on after passing through a lightning storm? Lack of oxygen made it hard to move and see and my flashlight kept going out. I floated there a few seconds longer, and happily embraced the sweet release of death.

Excellent game that forces you to decide which components you can ultimately do without in the name of survival. It's definitely not for everyone and I can't shake the feeling that something is missing that could make it perfect, but I still love this game. If you like troubleshooting in tense, life-or-death situations, I think you'll love this game too.
 
Unglued Bracelet
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 aout 2022
This is literally the first time I've ever requested a refund for a game on Steam.

I LOVE difficult games. I almost always add mods to games to up the realism or difficulty, but this game is just designed to be the biggest pain possible.

The concept of a game like this is amazing, but this one falls so very far away from the mark. I love games with neigh impossible learning curves, but this one isn't about learning anything. It's based on pure chance.

You start off in a pod that's missing tons of parts. And survival is based purely on if you're lucky enough that the random seed generator provided you with the right parts to fix anything. Pure chance. No real troubleshooting or problem solving. Nothing to feel clever about. Roll the dice and then be frustrated and angry while you attempt to "survive"

But, no, while that's bad enough that's not enough to make me want to refund my purchase. The cause of the refund is that this game is so terribly optimized that it constantly freezes and crashes to make the already terrible gameplay ramp to a rage inducing impossibilities. This just isn't a finished game at all and there's no way you could ever convince me anyone at Tin Can Studio playtested before release.

Do not buy this game unless you have a punishment kink or something.
 
Shadowsofink

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 3 aout 2022
My issues:
1) This does not feel like a full game. You can only do one thing, really. Speed runs for longer survival time. Rinse & repeat.
2) You need to learn a large bunch of error codes, otherwise you are lost. Not my idea of fun.
3) Everything is artificially made to be crap, it seems. Displays, systems, everything.

All in all;
It feels like a forced garbage situation with a very repeated & short game mode. Mostly a memory game.

Non recommandÃ©
3.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 mai 2022
Nope, sorry I cannot recommend at this time.

Pro's - Great idea, its a fun puzzle game (or would be, more in a sec) and I can see maybe getting into it very heavily in future after some serious fixes.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ -
-This is my biggest gripe. You manage to keep systems running and replace parts (because at least the early stages repairing is not a real option) for well over the time limit yet never get rescued. WTF!?!?! Send the bloody ship! I made it. I would say roughly half my games I make the time limit and end up dead because the rescue ship never arrives. Before the white knights arrive to offer BS excuses, yes my beacon was running and powered.

-You have a very small pool of resources to use, but repairing them depletes your pool even further. At least have the repair bench up and working, it's pretty ridiculous to stand there dying knowing you COULD fix the pod if you could just repair a component. Pretty frustrating and detracts from the fun.

-You only get a limited time before you have to abandon ship, I understand why, but maybe give a 90 second count down? This isn't really a broken part of the game, I would just suggest this at least the first real mission or two.

-Better tutorial. Explain you can (and need to) clean air filters, swap tanks etc. IT is mentioned, but the tutorial never really gets into it.

Over all I feel the bones are there they just need a lot more work to get to a fun and playable state. In my opinion of course.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 dÃ©cembre 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Ich habe das Spiel durch Zufall im Steam Winter Sale 2021 gesehen und dachte mir: "Sehr cool, ein SciFi VR Escape Room mit foto-realistischer Grafik? Muss ich haben!" Da die Rezensionen fÃ¼r dieses Spiel auch super sind, habe ich es mir direkt gekauft und... wurde massiv enttÃ¤uscht.

Wie ich erst spÃ¤ter erfahren habe, ist der VR Modus komplett neu (und beinhaltet nicht alle Ingame Features - nur Sandbox und Training!) Das an sich wÃ¤re sicher kein Problem, in 2D sieht das Spiel auch klasse aus, aber ich habe es mir fÃ¼r meine Quest 2 gekauft und da ist das Erlebnis ernÃ¼chternd, eigentlich sogar recht enttÃ¤uschend.

Kurz vorweg: Ja, das Spiel ist Early Access und ja, der VR Modus ist noch "brandneu", aber bei dem aktuellen Stand ist der VR Modus beim besten Willen nicht spielbar und hÃ¤tte lieber noch ein paar Monate unverÃ¶ffentlicht bleiben sollen! Es wird in den aktuellen Steam News (Ã¼ber das "Major VR Update") zwar erwÃ¤hnt, was man alles cooles in VR machen / erleben kann, aber viele Dinge die man (exklusiv in VR) NICHT bekommt, werden leider nicht erwÃ¤hnt, was mich auch zu dieser Rezension geleitet hat.

Das Ingame MenÃ¼ (direkt nach dem Starten) ist dem 2D MenÃ¼ nachempfunden (welches links am Bildschirmrand ist), was in VR mehr als komisch wirkt, als ob die Ausrichtung des Spielers in VR falsch wÃ¤re. Dadurch, dass es nach diesem ersten VerstÃ¤ndnisschock nur "Sandbox" und "Training" gibt, weiÃŸ man nicht wirklich was man tun soll. Nach einem kurzen Intro Video steht man in einer in VR sehr gut aussehenden, realistischen Kapsel. Dort zu finden ist ein Handbuch, welches - falls ich es mir als Tutorial hÃ¤tte durchlesen mÃ¼ssen - sicher nen ganzen Abend gedauert hÃ¤tte. An allen Ecken und Kanten der Kapsel sind Systeme, die so technisch aussehen, als sollte man sie lieber nicht anfassen. Eigentlich ist das Setting daher verdammt spannend gewÃ¤hlt, hÃ¤tte man vorher vielleicht ein "Astronautentraining" durchlaufen oder bekommt via Funk oder Computer-KI UnterstÃ¼tzung. Aber leider ist dies alles nicht der Fall, man steht verlassen in diesem technischen Meisterwerk von Kapsel und sollte lieber nicht versuchen ab hier in VR weiter zu spielen!

Das Spiel bekommt (sobald der VR Modus sauber lÃ¤uft) sicherlich einen Daumen hoch von mir, Idee, Umsetzung, Setting, AtmosphÃ¤re, alles sehr cool gemacht und in 2D sicher auch schÃ¶n zu spielen, wenn jemand aber vor hat es sich in VR zu kaufen, sollte er sich aktuell auf Bugs einstellen wie:

- Auf einmal auÃŸerhalb der Kapsel im Weltraum sein
- KnÃ¶pfe die bei falscher BerÃ¼hrung (vor oder hinter einem) an aus an aus an aus gehen
- Griffe (zum Herausziehen von Equipment) die nur funktionieren, wenn sie Lust haben
- Keine sichtliche Hilfe- oder Aufgabenstellung
- Minimierte Spielerfahrung, da nicht alle Modi in VR vorhanden sind
- Ruckelige, teils nicht intuitive Steuerung (auf der Quest 2)
- Ohne Gravitation(sgenerator) in der Kapsel muss man spezielle Haltegriffe nutzen, anstatt sich einfach irgendwo "fest zu halten" und ab zu stoÃŸen, das findet man aber auch nur durch Zufall heraus, ansonsten schwebt man herum und fÃ¼hlt sich wie ein Tischtennisball
- Wenig Platz in der Kapsel, wenn man den Strom- oder Gravitationsgenerator ausgefahren hat (und keine sichtliche MÃ¶glichkeit, sie wieder einzufahren, gepaart mit allen mÃ¶glichen KnÃ¶pfen, an die man dann aus versehen dran kommt, da man sich um diese Elemente herum bewegt)
- Viele kleine Bugs, die einem das komplette Erlebnis zerstÃ¶ren (was rein optisch in VR echt mega ist!)

Fazit: Das Spiel bleibt auf meiner Wishlist, ich werde es aber erstatten und hoffe, dass der VR Modus in einigen Monaten erheblich besser lÃ¤uft. Lasst aktuell die Finger davon, wenn ihr es rein fÃ¼r VR kauft!

Non recommandÃ©
2.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 juin 2022
I wish Steam gave more options that a Thumbs up / down rating as i will be giving this game a Thumbs down, but only due to my experience with it. Which is a shame as i can see that the game is well made, with good controls, visuals and sounds, However i REALLY struggled with the amount of things going wrong at once, by the time you have looked up an error code in the book and replaced the faulty item, 3 other things have gone wrong, each requiring time to diagnose and fix, which one do you fix first? For me this game just piles too much time pressure problems on you at once, which makes it a very stressful experience.
BUT like i said, for people able to cope with this high pressure environment, or find the secret gameplay method i just didn't see, i can see you getting enjoyment from it.

A amazing game (i'm playing it on vr with the beta release)
and its is phenomenal. the systems parts are immensely well done. not only they have stages of failure but they also have functions sounds minor but being able to substitute parts and sometimes even ditch bad components to save one system knowing that you WILL have a drawback to it. but you can live with that makes it even better than most other "fix" and "crisis management" games, trying to juggle your fuses and transformers between your life support system to keep the oxygen and Co2 balanced. while putting out fires worried that you will need to turn on the AC again. and the only battery you have full is in the gravity gen makes its at the same time a puzzle and an adventure. that you can get better and better

its that easy to learn difficult to master game

The tutorial is going to essential teach you how â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ the hot keys are and how often your going to unplug things by hitting right and left click because your going to spend 90% of the game in the dark with a flash light that lasts 10 seconds. The tutorial is also going to cover non of what happens in the "campaign". You just have to arbitrarily guess what is wrong in 15 seconds or congrats on dying to hypoxia and letting the death screen tell you how you f'ed up and a possible way to fix it.

How this game starts it's "Campaign" is by placing you in a hallway with 6 storage rooms and about 30 seconds to play "Supermarket Sweep". Except it all air filters and master alarm buttons. Great we can just scrap them with the thing the tutorial taught me... Right? Nope that whole repair bay has been scrapped to high hell. And you don't have the parts unlocked to repair it anyway.

Essentially at the survive 15 minutes mark the ship is going to do everything but actually explode, great just replace the parts? No some â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ lord took all of them and sold them to buy hentai games on steam sale and the rare parts you do get are random so during supermarket sweep you guess at what you might need. Also the ships on fire, your C02 is 100% you main computer never worked, gravity is off, and every electrical component is fried but you don't know that because you can't power anything to get a trouble code.

Non recommandÃ©
1.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 novembre 2023
I got this for $1, and this game is barely worth that IMO.

More than less you are tasked with trying to keep a life pod alive for x amount of time. You can do something like 6 minutes, 15 minutes, etc. But to go from one to the other you have to complete the prior. But huge chunks of the prior is the same as the next. The stages are static as far as what can go wrong, but outside of trail and error you have no idea what to grab prior. In some cases you will have no idea what is wrong without outside guides. For example, the power goes out in one of the stages with the storm. But there is 0 indication on why. So you're sitting there flipping the main switch. And without an outside guide or raw luck, there is no good way to figure out why.

Monsy
123 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 juillet 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

The premise of Tin Can bubbles with promise: you are in a failing escape pod and need to stay alive long enough to be picked up by rescuers. Parts on your ship keep going wrong and you have to fix them. You are presented with a long technical manual, a list of error codes, some rudimentary spare parts and a repair/dismantle station and wished good luck. The gameplay loop consists of repairing each item as it breaks and trying to stay cool under pressure until you're overwhelmed and inevitably die. There are a vast array of gauges, monitors and components to keep an eye on and possibly failure points.

The setup is a little bit like a single-player Keep Talking And Nobody Explodes, with the addition of tactical decision-making: if the CO2 scrubber breaks, should I dismantle the emergency lights to get a replacement part, knowing that we might lose main lighting later on?

In principle, this all sounds great. Sadly, the execution is woeful. The tutorial is absolutely horrible, facing you in the wrong direction, not highlighting or misnaming the discussed components, and not giving clear directions on how things work. The main game modes throw you in at the deep end with alert sirens going off and you quickly die before you can even figure out what's wrong, let alone how to fix it. The learning curve is just far too brutal for all but the most patient of spacefarers.

At the time of writing this game is in Early Access and I think it has a ton of potential and could be one to watch, but I can't recommend it in its current state unfortunately.

and put your helmet on

engines on

and may God's love be with you

to Major Tom

And the papers want to know whose shirts you wear

if you dare

in a most peculiar way

SuperNiceGuy
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1,249.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 aout 2023
Tin Can is an extraordinary and heartwarming adventure that will whisk you away on a delightful journey through a charming world. This endearing puzzle-platformer, wrapped in a captivating narrative, follows the heartwarming story of a tiny robot exploring a whimsical universe filled with mystery and wonder. The game's stunning hand-drawn art style and enchanting soundtrack create a truly immersive and magical experience. As you navigate through challenging puzzles and engaging platforming sequences, you'll find yourself emotionally invested in the robot's quest for connection and belonging. Tin Can's unique gameplay mechanics and clever level design offer a perfect balance of challenge and enjoyment, making each puzzle a satisfying triumph. This gem of a game offers a much-needed reminder of the power of friendship and the beauty of the human (or rather, robotic) spirit. So don your thinking cap and embark on this touching adventure that will leave you with a smile on your face and warmth in your heart. Tin Can is a delightful and uplifting experience that deserves a special place in every gamer's library.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 aout 2022
Zero optimisation issues, and zero bugs aside from the beginning of challenges freezing if you skip the cut-scene too fast, not sure what these reviews are talking about. The game values efficient problem solving and a little bit of memorisation. It's far from an ultra-realistic space survival sim but it does not present itself as being one. People complaining about the learning curve should stay away from any kind of technical puzzle game, and anyone complaining about mission length should steer clear of survival games. Finish the missions and you'll get access to all the stations (including the repair station others are complaining about). You can also run faster while crouched than standing which I admit is odd.

StG2_Marder
0
3 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
63.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 dÃ©cembre 2021
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

NOTE: I received this game for free from the developers because I was very active in the community and worked on several related projects. However, the developers had no input on this review. The main part is for the regular version of the game, but I've included a small segment at the bottom for VR.

TLDR: If you don't mind this game being relatively shallow in terms of events and pacing, and are willing to trust the devs to attempt to improve the game (As I personally do), then you will probably enjoy Tin Can. If not, I'd recommend holding off for now but keeping an eye on it.

Whether or not you enjoy Tin Can as a game is almost entirely dependant on the genres of games you enjoy and your preferred pacing.

Tin Can is primarily a survival game where the goal is to navigate through a series of events while keeping your pod as intact as possible. It strives to be as realistic as possible, and for the most part it succeeds. There is a big problem though, and that is it has very little depth and relies heavily on randomness. Most games you play will have very slow pacing; I often find myself with a lot of time between events just doing nothing. On the other hand, if you get bad luck, you can often find yourself overwhelmed with things that need fixing. Whether you like this or not is entirely up to personal preference, of course.

Another issue is that the system control is very shallow. It either works, or it does not. Additionally, most systems aren't interconnected as much as I personally would like them to be. All you really need is the O2/CO2 systems, the CO2>O2 system, and the main generator. While I do think this is intentional on the developers part, allowing your circumstances to be fluid and to force the player to make tradeoffs in ease of use for longer survival times, you might not particularly enjoy this. Also, with only 6 events currently, it's somewhat limited in terms of unique situations.

HOWEVER, it is very important to note that this is a early access game, and I do honestly believe the developers are committed to improving the game in all aspects. Recent updates also have partially addressed these issues.

About VR: I had the pleasure of trying the VR version of this game recently, and it was a lot of fun. Although it can be motion-sickness inducing on occasion, and it feels easy to clip through walls accidentally, I'd recommend you try it if you already have a VR headset.
 
GTink911
44 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 novembre 2023
Nope! I had my doubts about this when the opening screen says be prepared to die often as you slowly learn the game. But, even with that downer, I decided to give the tutorial a try. You know, a tutorial that's suppose to explain how things work, and doesn't just say "Do this, do that". I figured if I was already this frustrated just in the tutorial, the actual game would probably drive me bonkers. So, I exited and removed it from my hard driver never to be seen again.
 
Darkman
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
23.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 juillet 2022
This is so far my 3rd favorite game, 3rd only to Star Citizen and Stationeers. I love games with as much space survival realism as possible. I would like to confirm that Tin Can is so far at least playable on a MacBook Pro 14" M1 Pro baseline using Parallels 17 (I'm just using perpetual license version) in a Windows 11 for Arm VM. So far, unlike a lot of other games and I do mean a lot, which works very very well to almost perfectly, Tin Can on the other hand is at least playable. In the escape scene FPS is a slight bit erratic. bit normally much better once in the Escape Pod Scene. In the Escape Pod scene there are some rare occasional game freeze-unfreeze moments, which may frustrate others but doesn't really affect gameplay. So far it happens once or twice, but most of the time none in game. I Hope this would help someone on the fence, as I believe this game deserves more players. Thanks Tin Can Studio and IndieArk for making this game for us.

RecommandÃ©

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 avril 2021
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Have you ever wondered if you would survive in an environment with no lights, no gravity, with floating pieces around you, while trying to fix critical systems to keep you alive? If you did, then congrats, you're a survival nerd and you NEED this.

Controls are amazing, you get used to being able to use both hands really quickly. Movement in no-gravity environments feels great. Everything's looking good, even in early access. The hazards feel real and challenge you to think ways to keep your tin can in one piece.

The team behind this is amazing, and the game's development is community driven. So, what could go wrong? *BUZZ* *SPARKS* *FIRE*

TLDR: There is no point in playing this game except to survive longer aka running a timer up. There is no adventure, nothing to be gained by playing.

The escape pod is very well modeled, well thought through from a visual point.

I've written a longer review but when I submitted it, steam threw a error. I'm not typing that again.

Anyways, I'm gonna try and return it. It's a very nice game - with now point in playing it.

Wat een vet concept, en wat een goede uitvoering! Je zit alleen in een escape pod, en er kan elk moment iets misgaan: je vliegt door een asteroidenregen, een elektrische storm, en alles in je pod kan kapot. Maar: je kan ook alles repareren!

En dan is het ook nog eens in VR te spelen!

Dikke aanrader voor de lost in space vibes.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 aout 2022
Feels janky, and scripted.
Run is painfully slow and stupid things like an escape pod with main systems not working and not fully stocked. Instead you have 60 seconds to grab as much stuff as you can running painfully slow. Battery cells deplete too fast, this is a game developed by masochists for masochists. If you like whipping yourself with splintered bamboo then buy it. Way too much stress for a game, plus constant failures, no repair station because it needs parts fromt he start.... horse sh*t.

I'd rather play "give myself a root canal with a dirty drill" than play this tripe.

ĞĞ° Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ²ĞµÑ‡ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ°, Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ°Ñ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾. ĞŸĞ¾ ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑÑŒ.
 
NoOne
250 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 juillet 2022
I purchased based completely on the trailer. I was disappointed.
There is a total lock of direction here.
The game needs a radio, somebody your avatar can talk to for tips - thinking of this gives me apollo 13 vibes.
But this game is just a weird sandbox, stuff breaks down and you have to fix it by reading error codes and sort stuff out.
There is no way to live longer other than practice and repetition....this is the only way to learn and this gets dull fast.
non-vr players get tips when they hover over things they can interact with.
VR users are not told they can clean, shake or replace anything. It just glows blue if it can be interacted with.

***Response to Developer response 1***

I was discussing this with a flatscreen gamer friend. They are enjoying the quick snappy controls and the key presses.
In VR, I tend to pick stuff up and look at it and wonder "Wtf, do I do with this thing?".
His advise was to check out youtube and play flatscreen.
I felt kind of put off by both options.

It feels a bit like "Keep talking and nobody explodes" but solo. I think I was hoping for more Apollo 13 vibes i mentioned earlier.

I get the random events, it makes for replay. But it seems the mission is the clock.

I wish this little pod could dock with a container of spare parts or tools. Or dock with a larger tin can with a varied layout for some complexity, variety and difficulty. A coop game with 2 tin cans or more linked by a passage feels like another game I won't mention. Players need to share resources rather than recycle and repair, repeat. Perhaps cannibalize one can for parts and jettison. All wishful thoughts I guess

As a sole survivor in a pod avoiding death by mechanical failure, i think it does alright.

Regarding Zero G movement: I recommend you play Lone Echo 1 or 2 as zero G in that game is fantastic and I quickly turned off gravity to play and move like that again. However i was thrown around the cabin at top speed.

William, looking forward to V1.0. Good look with this project.
 
Hicks

'Now draw the rest of the .... Owl'
------------------------------------

I went in never having played a game like this before, and perhaps that was my mistake.
The jump from 'tutorial' levels to actual gameplay was so great it simply became overwhelming, and there seemed no way to 'make it easier' to start with (that didn't involve some daunting custom setup menu.)

If you tweaked some of the difficulty settings I'd consider revising this, but for now it doesn't feel like great gameplay flow.

REVIEW + GAMEPLAY VIDEOS
Tin Can is INCREDIBLE. It makes something as complex as Rocket Science so simple that ANYONE can play & yet it retains a feeling of being complex & Realistic.

Early Access and the plans for the future are really exciting!

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
19.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Tin Can was a refreshing experience for me. Not only an Early Access title that's working, fun, almost entirely bug free and has enough content that it feels a lot more finished than a lot of other finished games out there - the game is new, it's innovative, I've not played anything like and I'm LOVING IT.

As it stands, your goal is to prolong death. You're going to die, that's inevitable - but it's a race against yourself and other players via leaderboard to see exactly how long you can keep this crappy little Tin Can from murdering you.

The Tin Can is a highly complex conglomeration of ancient technology, my own motivation to survive inside of it was to punch whoever left me with this as an escape pod right in the face. What I was most impressed with was how the developer managed to keep the systems insanely complex, but still using a homogeneous selection of parts that can be interchanged between units - which is critical to success in this game. It feels like everything was thought of - unplugging a battery might cause a sudden voltage surge which heats up its transformer which increases cabin heat a bit, but if you switch that unit off first you avoid the entire chain of events. It's incredibly easy to let one small interaction cascade into a dozen independent, fatal errors - and trying to think of more efficient ways to slightly prolong my death has proven endlessly entertaining. My first escape lasted two minutes, now I can last twenty regularly - some folks have lasted more than 2 hours. Experimentation is rewarded as often as it is punished.

On top of it, the developer is highly active in Discord and clearly a motivated individual. They're friendly, open to suggestion and are willing to share with the community the development of this game they obviously love - which shows.

I can't recommend TIn Can enough. It's worth every cent as-is, and what's coming down the pipe - more equipment, more failure types, more game modes (even one where you might not die) sound really, really cool. I've not been this entertained with a Steam purchase in some time.
 
AugustsEve

0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 fÃ©vrier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

It's rough. Even the tutorial is pretty unfriendly:

* it took me a while to figure out that dismantled components subtly go dark colored rather than being truly destroyed/used up; this could be more clear
* it neglects to tell you you can crouch with CTRL, and this is needed early on to reach things at low heights!
* (spoiler) when you get to the part of the "encrypted" error codes, it's not at all clear what you have to do; you basically have to make a leap of logic about which part is the problem, and all the while you're slowly dying

I think it has the potential to be a fun game so I'll try it again in a few months and update my review if it's a smoother experience then.
 
RelaxItsJustAGame

0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Vomit Simulator
- The field of view is too narrow.
This causes motion sickness and nausea for a lot of us.
There is no in-game way to change the FOV.

- It feels like you are floating on the floor instead of walking on the floor.
You do not see your legs and it does not feel like you are actually on the floor.
This gives a further nauseating effect.


This uses the Unity game engine. Modding the game code is possible, including forcing a new FOV, however no matter what you set it to the game camera behaves strangely and you'll feel nauseated anyway.
 
Un dÃ©veloppeur ou une dÃ©veloppeuse a rÃ©pondu Ã  cette Ã©valuation

911 produits enregistrÃ©s

2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Pretty disappointed with this game. The idea was neat but I find the gameplay and the controls painful.
The escape pod feels nice and detailed but couldn't find fun in the way you play.
A dozen of systems will start breaking down and you have to perform some maintenance on them.
Most of the time, the error is displayed on the screen of this system and the repair always consist in either replacing the broken element in this system with the same one of another system or to scrap one working element in order to gain repair points and repair the broken parts.
And, that is all.
The difficulty increases when, for instance, the gravity system or oxygen system slows you down due to bad functionning.
I played an hour and a half and couldn't start to see a progression curve in the gameplay or any fun aspect apart from the nice 3D.
Not recommended

Kite
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 janvier
I've always wanted to play a "space mechanic" game, and this is as close as I've found. You are stuck in a piece of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ escape pod and have to survive. There's two modes, one where you just try to survive as long as possible, and then a "rescue" mode that works like a campaign where you need to survive for a set amount of time before being rescued, while going through scripted events with certain systems in the pod not immediately usable.

I'm enjoying the game quite a bit, at the time of this writing, I'm finishing up the rescue mode. I don't think it has a TON of replay value once you've done a lot of the scripted stuff, because once you know how to handle each disaster, or you know what is coming, then that's pretty much the challenge. I got this in a bundle and I don't regret it at all, certainly if it's on sale I'd highly recommend this, but I can't imagine getting more than 8-10 hours of play out of this at this time.
 
Palleon

Zenric
121 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 dÃ©cembre 2023
I repair wide format inkjet printers professionally. Doing my â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ job is more fun than this and I even get paid for it.
Basically what I kinda misunderstood was that this game is not about the repairing. It's about to know what system is important and what system is not and can be scrapped for spare parts. Unfortunatly the tutorial for this information is kinda missing. You are supposed to figure out the whole â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ yourself since you are canonically just the janitor. The game says right in the main menu you should read the manual. Unfortunately this manual is one of the worst I ever had and I saw a lot! It describes the error codes, systems and components with a few warnings. That's it.
In my opionion this is the worst part.
Did you know that real maintenance manuals have incredibly easy step by step instructions for checking and reapairing stuff with a really big part for trouble shooting? Some of them even have check lists so you don't accidently skip a step.
In the game you have a "printed" version but there is also a PDF version online. The game doesn't keep you from pausing so you can take all the time you need and read that version instead. The online PDF is nice but only if you use it in english. The german version that I used doesn't look so nice (what makes it actually look more realistic) and is missing the links where you can quickly skip through the document. Fortunatly the manual is just about 35 pages long so scrolling isn't too much a problem.

I'm not quiet sure how much of this hassle is supposed by the developers to be part of the game. I mean I get it, they throw you in this situation, you don't know anything, you try to survive with a useless manual. But usually you also don't do that like 20 times a day so I think there is nothing wrong with having some more Tutorials or some sort of "easy-survival-missions" for the beginning - or at least a much better manual with a trouble shooting part.
The game didn't hooked me but maybe I will give it a chance later again. In the meantime I will keep repairing printers.
 
Drayventhal

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 dÃ©cembre 2023
Tin Can is a technical puzzle / survival game in the vein of Hardspace Shipbreaker, with a similar commentary on the overall world system, but is also a physical system simulation. As the description states, you are in a janky escape pod that will soon encounter all sorts of... spatial phenomena that will cause all sorts of problems for your pod, any of which has the potential toward discontinuation of your survival. Your only chance is knowing what to do with whatever parts you have onboard, and cannibalize whatever systems you have, to keep your beacon and life support on.

If your pod went through an asteroid field, you will develop leaks, which you must plug using sealant.

If your pod went through an electromagnetic storm, you will lose a LOT of parts due to sparkly damage, unless you manage to disconnect the systems in time. But turning them off will lead to your own demise... unless you turn them back on in time, and there are multiple systems... O2 pump, CO2 concentrator, heater, and N2 regulator. All of which requires POWER to run. So... either fix the atomic pile... or find batteries...

Well, no more spoilers. Let's just say, you will learn to interpret the incomprehensible error codes and figure out what you need to sacrifice from your existing systems to prolong your life and beacon... in "real-time". Obviously... Don't open the atomic pile, don't open the airlock, don't touch a live circuit... you get the idea. :)

How long can you survive? There are a couple different benchmarks... Start with a simple... 6 minutes. Go up to 10, then 15... Which will unlock advanced parts for you each step. Can you make it to 60 minutes?

And if you got bored, there's always... challenge mode. :)

There is a tutorial (4 in fact), and a sandbox mode for you to try things.

And you actually have to slide out cabinets, pull parts out, put parts back in, and so on. (virtually, of course) and if you lose artificial gravity, well, you'll have to use the handholds.

So it's not easy, and quite challenging.

But it's your survival at stake. How will you do?
 
kschang77

RecommandÃ©
4.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 septembre 2023
People are reviewing this game like they haven't played an indie game in their life if what they're complaining about are controls and "physics". They wouldn't get past the menu screen in Hand Simulator or Octodad lol.

It's exactly what it looks like. It's not meant to be easy, you're supposed to go in blind and not know much of anything and do your absolute best. You're just a janitor and you've only done a couple basic runs (tutorial) before all hell breaks loose and you have 1 minute to haul whatever you can carry into the pod. Every scenario adds challenges. You'll be feeling like the game isn't too bad but then scenario-15 minute hits and you're crying and yelling and trying everything you could possibly think of until eventually you figure out more and more through trial and error. I'm a big dummy and I enjoyed the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ out of the game despite failing as often as I did, wait for it to be on sale, or snag it in humble store. It isn't a bad game, people are just bougie.
 
Veriin
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 aout 2023
It's alright, I enjoyed it for a bit but it's not my kind of game. The games a lot more frantic than I would have liked and many systems in the pod just aren't put together until you unlock them, even though you use them in the tutorial. It kind of just throws you in and expects you to figure out what to do, which I would like more if the manual actually had some useful information besides error codes.

I also found a few bugs mostly visual but there was one where I couldn't put parts into the slots which got me killed. It's also really easy to click on the wrong part, which also got me killed when I grabbed a live transformer.

I could see someone really enjoying this game if they are into hardcore simulators or like feeling stressed, but this isn't the game for me

5/10
 
Janspach

Simpatica simulazione di sopravvivenza in una capsula di salvataggio. Seguendo le istruzioni e un pizzico di ragionamento bisognerÃ  riuscire a sopravvivere mantenendo in funzione almeno i sistemi vitali. L'idea Ã¨ carina, ma dopo qualche partita diventano tutte uguali a causa delle poche meccaniche presenti. Le sfide sono probabilmente la parte piÃ¹ interessante, mettendosi alla prova in situazioni molto particolari, ma terminate quelle, il ranking non offre molta competizione: al terzo tentativo era giÃ  nei primi 50 di sempre.
Nel complesso quindi un'idea carina, ma che diventa presto ripetitiva, Consigliato, ma solo in sconto.

Knight errant of the Holy Conker
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
6.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 avril 2023
Edit: I added the third, fourth, fifth, and the manual
Edit 2: Correction on review count

First I should say I have played tons of games and this is only the second time I've written a review, This game is great, I love it, I don't really know how else to put it, It can be really hard and I haven't played it much yet but I think I will play it plenty
However I do have a few Critiques

First: Demo should allow you to play a quick game, maybe a modified version of the 6 minute rescue scenario, as playing the demo didn't give me as good of an idea of how the game would work as I would have liked

Second: Save data; It would be nice if you could sync save data between 2 computers and between demo so I don't have to playthough the tutorial again so it doesn't ask me if I want to play since I haven't done the tutorial

Third: Manual rework would be nice as some things aren't mentioned in there and it can take a bit to figure it out either by A. Trial and Error B. The tips during loading C. Google
Although tips during loading makes sense, some of those things should be mentioned in the manual, An example of this is the data connector, when its broken it causes an error code to look like squares, but the manual doesnt outright say that, it only says that it may cause unreadable data, similar to IRL Manuals they give a guide to how to do something so maybe something like that for certain issues, this could even allow for more complicated issues to occur as you could then find the way to solve it

Fourth: The reward system of rescue, until I completed the 10 minute challange I didnt know that the systems had to be unlocked, and so I ended up repairing them during the 6 and 10 min rescues

Fifth: Manual Rework Pt.2; Although this would have been helpful for me when I was constructing the systems from scratch, it would still be useful if in the manual there were diagrams of each system showing where each part goes, similar to a real manual

Here is the manual for a Boeing 747 that can show good examples of what I'm describing
http://landrover.narod.ru/gershon/AIRPLANTANK/747-400_operations_manual.pdf
 
Pesto&PotatoSoupMaster-Vaultech

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 janvier 2023
I recently played the game and I have to say, it was a blast! The survival mechanics are top-notch and kept me on the edge of my seat. The game is about surviving on a space ship and it has a great sense of realism. The manual for troubleshooting and repairing components adds a lot of depth to the gameplay. The unexpected events like black holes also keep things interesting. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys survival games. I hope to see many updates in the future.

Some of the disasters feel a bit insane to deal with like the black hole, You should open the door to vent the air and reduce pressure. but then it's a question of how do you replace that pressure later, use up the little Nitro you have left?
 
Little_Jack
408 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
13.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 novembre 2022
A few game modes, but basically, you escape a ship in an escape pod that is on the fritz, and will be fully repaired "next week".

So you have to try to survive long enough to get rescued. Their's a 5-30 minute ways, going up in 5 minute increments for different ones.

Their's also surviving for as long as you can in a not busted escape pod, except for the distress signal. So, a survive as long as you can kinda thing.

Various events try to screw you up such as meteor shower, electrical storm, ice patch, heat thing... I don't recall the names off the top of my head, but they all suck. Especially that electrical storm. Worst one for me.

Best kind of frustrating, as it makes it so much more satisfying when you get past that point.
 
Foxx
671 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
6.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 novembre 2022
Have you every wanted to experience dying alone in space due to your own incompetence? Now you can! Have the cosmos take your breath away because your ship is full of hull breaches! Feel the warm glow of the powerful star because you disconnected the climate control battery to run the lights! Experience the electric thrill of solo space adventure because you have no fuses left and your really needed that electric component!

Fun. The game has a good tutorial for working up to the complexity of having every system online. Short beginning missions with only a few systems and hazards. Then it builds in complexity as you have more systems and the time until rescue grows longer and longer.
 
Sir Finnbar

19.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 novembre 2022
Very fun game! I constantly attempt to speed run this game and despite the difficulty, I currently at the time of writing find myself in 24th place. The game gets stupidly complicated at times but if you can memorize codes and live without white lights and gravity you're good to go. Highly recommend it, interesting events such as black holes and suns passing you by give you unique scenarios to deal with such as increased pressure and heat management.
 
ItsChugg
588 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 novembre 2022
Great game! I'm actually not really into space games, but I really enjoy this.

In a nutshell, your goal is to survive in outer space in a (cute?) little escape pod. The biggest priority here is to make sure you maintain your oxygen, Co2 and pressure 'atmosphere' within the pod. But apart from that, there's a heap of other systems maintenance to keep you well-occupied.

It's not all about floating away in space without a care in the world. Along the way, you will encounter a handful (5?) different 'events' in outer space (such as an asteroid field), and each event has the ability to inflict a certain type or amount of damage. Even if this sounds scripted, I've actually found that the failures are very randomised, so there's a lot of variety to keep you interested.

If you like realistically simulated systems and having to maintain them by troubleshooting and swapping-out faulty components, repairing components, etc, you will love this game I think. There is also a detailed technical manual in your escape pod so you can lookup error codes to troubleshoot system failures before you take action.

I've seen people mention that replayability is not great with this game but I actually disagree with that; I think given the amount of systems (and individual components within each system, such as air filters, fuses, switches, CRT monitors, etc) and the fact that no one scenario will ever play out the same if you play it twice, there is a lot of randomised gameplay opportunities within this game.

Definitely addictive!

P.S. initially the anxiety of encountering the 'death simulation' (breathlessness, etc) is a bit nerve-wracking but once you get over that and learn more about how to survive in your little pod, you'll find yourself coming back to this game again and again.
 
HarmanMotor
0

213 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
12.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 septembre 2022
Where to start? For me, this game is amazing, not only for the game play, but for the price as well. At $20 this is a solid little game to sink some time into again and again. It's very hard to put down!

There are 5 events that can effect you and your little escape pod. Each event you have to work quickly to either mitigate any incoming damage or to repair damage. This game requires you to make choices on what to keep and what to fix. Additionally, it does require you to understand how the events work and how each component/systems works in order to survive. You can only understand them by reading the manual, playing the tutorial, and playing/dying in game.

There are a few different types of game play available here. First is the rescue missions: you start in a ship and have 60 secs to grab a bunch of components. You then have to survive X amount of time before being rescued. Second is the sandbox: here you start in the pod and can control all of the game properties such as the time scale and event to start. Lastly, is the ranked game: here you start in the pod and basically survive as long as you can. Once dead, you are show your place on a global leader board. At time of writing the longest survival time is just over 4 hours. Finally, there are scenarios that will test your skills. Each scenario will feature a certain major aspect of the game for you to learn or to just challenge your skills.

The game does allow you to create your own custom scenarios which is cool. Once you play through the rescue missions, you probably won't be playing them again. Same goes for the challenge scenarios. Most of the replay value will be to survive longer and longer in the ranked survival game play.

In closing, I will say this is a good little indie game worth picking up. It has solid game play, good game design, sound/graphics look amazing, I have encountered no bugs, and for the price of $20 it was well worth the money. If you aren't quiet sold on it, then try the demo or wait for a Steam sale. Finally, I will mention that this game requires good spacial memory and quick problem solving skills. If you want to play a casual put your feet up and troubleshoot problems then this game is not for you. If you can't manage to think more than 1 step ahead then this game is not for you. The first 3 hours of the game or so will literally be high stress and very panicked game play. However, it's not difficult at all - just a higher than normal learning curve.
 
TeamDeer
300 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
13.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 aout 2022
If you're looking for edge of your seat action of a different kind from typical survival games, this is definitely for you. The systems and resource management coupled with the mad dash for components at the beginning of rescue scenarios makes for some truly compelling gameplay. Finding ways to cannibalize parts that you forgot at start definitely requires some quick thinking, and one quickly gets the hang of risk management working with the decrepit systems of the Medusa.

Very friendly and responsive devs that very clearly love the game they're working on

12/10 would die again.

it's a first person perspective escape pod game. hmmm I think it's worth the price, but you could get a pizza instead.

Update: Who needs a manual? Anyway, I did learn from the dev stream recording that you can find out if a part is damaged by putting it into the repair module. I think there is some little visual indicator when you look at the part, like color darkening etc.

THIS GAME IS ABSOLUTE HYSTERICAL MAYHEM! WE LAUGHED AND LAUGHED AS WE REALISED WE ARE NOT RIPLEY OR DATA AND GOT SNUFFED OUT WITHIN SECONDS EACH TIME UNTIL WE GOT TO 8 MINUTES!
MY PARTNER WHO PRIDES HIMSELF ON HIS GAMING SKILLS JUST COULDN'T STAY ALIVE FOR MORE THAN A FEW MINUTES.
THE GAME IS SO TECHNICAL, YET COMMON SENSE, YET MADNESS, YET CLAUSTROPHOBIC AND VERY FUNNY TOO.
MAKE SURE YOU DO THE TUTORIAL IF YOU WANT TO SURVIVE. BE PREPARED FOR SHOCKS. BE READY-BECAUSE NO ONE CAN HEAR YOU SCREAM!
10/10 FOR HUMILIATING YOUR BIG HEAD GAMING MATES AT A FREE FOR ALL PARTY NIGHT.

RecommandÃ©
6.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 juillet 2022
Murphy's Law: The Game.

It's a very high tension game especially before you unlock the master computer starts; things will go wrong and you'll have to quickly fix it before things go even wrong-er. It's not hard to enter a death spiral where you just can't fix things faster than they're breaking, and even if you do manage to get everything up and running you'll just suffocate before the systems fix your atmosphere.

It is not, however, Apollo 13/The Martian: The Game.
Due to the above, the game values speed above all else when it comes to repairs. You rarely have time to actually consult the manual, and most of it is useless garbage anyways; all you really need are the error codes...and they're disorganized as â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.

The only problem is, once you reach the 20-25 minute runs, you've likely become pretty adept at understanding how to not only fix things, but prevent them from breaking in the first place.

And once you've reached that point, the game becomes significantly easier. Which isn't always a good thing.

I recommend it only because it's still a fun game, but it still leaves a lot to be desired.
 
koimeiji

RecommandÃ©
22.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 juin 2022
I'd categorize this as half-brutalist survival game, half-tinker toy. The game is not merciful, but it is relatively fair, and it's a very rewarding process to hone your understanding of the escape pod and survive for longer periods of time. I'd recommend this to anyone interested in an intelligent game which takes not just skill, but technical understanding to really master.
I will say that twenty whole dollars is a bit much for a game this small, though, so maybe wait for a sale.

RecommandÃ©
64.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 juin 2022
It's intense but fun. You must stay alive and keep your escape capsule intact until help arrives while repairing subsystems, replacing parts, troubleshooting electrical problems and maintaining an oxygen atmosphere. 10/10 would play again. I recommend playing the sandbox mode and getting familiar with the in-game manual (a book sitting on a shelf) and triggering events yourself so you can get accustomed to them at your own pace. â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥: It needs more levels, co-op multiplayer mode, more part types, etc. But, it has a bright future.

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

æ¬¢è¿å…³æ³¨æˆ‘ä»¬çš„é‰´èµå®¶ã€ä¸­å›½ç©å®¶é‰´èµç»„ã€‘ åŠ å…¥æˆ‘ä»¬çš„å°ç»„å§ã€ç‚¹è¿™é‡Œã€‘

è™½ç„¶åˆ¶ä½œè€…è¯´ã€Šç½èˆ±ã€‹çš„åŒäººç©æ³•ç±»ä¼¼ã€Šä¿æŒé€šè¯ä¸ç‚¸ã€‹ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å•äººä½“éªŒæ›´åƒæ˜¯æ‰‹å¿™è„šä¹±çš„å¤ªç©ºç‰ˆã€Š60Sã€‹ã€‚

åœ¨åˆ«çš„ç”Ÿå­˜æ¸¸æˆé‡Œï¼Œä½ è‡³å°‘ä¸ç”¨ä»»ä½•ç»éªŒå’ŒåŸºç¡€å°±çŸ¥é“æ–§å­å¯ä»¥ç æ ‘ï¼Œç¨¿å­å¯ä»¥æŒ–çŸ¿ï¼Œæµ†æœå¯ä»¥åƒï¼Œæ°´å¯ä»¥å–ï¼Œå¯¹äºçªå‘çš„ç¾éš¾ä¹ŸçŸ¥é“å…µæ¥å°†æŒ¡æ°´æ¥åœŸæ©ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å½“ä½ è¿›å…¥å¤ªç©ºï¼Œé¢å¯¹å®Œå…¨é™Œç”Ÿçš„é£è¡Œèˆ±å®¤ä»¥åŠå„ç§çªå‘äº‹ä»¶æ—¶ï¼Œå³ä½¿ä½ è®¤çœŸçš„é˜…è¯»æ¸¸ç©äº†æ•™ç¨‹ä¹Ÿä¸èƒ½ä¿è¯è®¤è¯†å…¨éƒ¨çš„é…ä»¶ï¼Œä»è¿™ä¸€ç‚¹è€Œè¨€ï¼Œã€Šç½èˆ±ã€‹çš„ä¸Šæ‰‹éš¾åº¦æ˜¯è¿œé«˜äºå…¶å®ƒåŒç±»å‹æ¸¸æˆçš„ã€‚

å½“ä½ å¼€å§‹ç†Ÿæ‚‰ä¹‹åï¼Œæ¸¸æˆä»¿ä½›å°±è¿›å…¥äº†ç®€å•æ¨¡å¼ï¼Œæ— è®ºæ˜¯å°è¡Œæ˜Ÿå¸¦ã€é»‘æ´å¥‡ç‚¹ã€å¸¦ç”µç²’å­æµã€ä½æ¸©æµç­‰ä»»ä½•æƒ…å†µï¼Œæœ€åä½ è¦åšçš„å¯ä»¥å¤§è‡´æ¦‚æ‹¬æˆçœ‹å“ªä¸ªé›¶ä»¶åäº†â†’ä¿®å®ƒâ†’ç­‰å®ƒåâ†’ç»§ç»­ä¿®çš„å¾ªç¯ä½“éªŒï¼Œä¸”ä»ç¡¬æ ¸ç”Ÿå­˜å˜æˆäº†è€ƒéªŒè®°å¿†åŠ›ã€æ‰‹é€Ÿçš„æ¸¸æˆï¼Œæ¸¸æˆå†…å®¹åœ¨ç›®å‰æ¥çœ‹è¿˜æ˜¯æ¯”è¾ƒå°‘çš„ï¼Œä¸è¿‡å¯èƒ½å› ä¸ºå¾æœå¤©ç©ºæ˜¯å¾ˆå¤šäººæ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å®‡å®™è¿™ä¸ªç¥ç§˜çš„ä¸»é¢˜ä¹Ÿç»™è¶³äº†ç©å®¶é€šå…³ä¹‹åçš„æˆå°±æ„Ÿã€‚

ã€Šç½èˆ±ã€‹è¿˜æä¾›äº†é™æ—¶æ•‘æ´ã€äº‹ä»¶æŒ‘æˆ˜ã€ç¡¬æ ¸ç»ƒä¹ ã€æ²™ç›’æ¨¡å¼åŠæ²‰æµ¸æ„Ÿæ›´é«˜çš„VRæ¨¡å¼ï¼Œå¯¹å–œæ¬¢å¤ªç©ºä¸»é¢˜çš„ç©å®¶æ¥è¯´ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è€ƒè™‘å…¥æ‰‹ã€‚
 
An.
1,384 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
17.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 mai 2022
TRES BON PETIT JEU,
j'adore le concept, les tutos sont plutot bien fait, les defis et challenges progressifs, bon equilibre. Il y a un mode competitif pour se jauger aux autres joueurs.

La seule chose dont je suis pas trop fan sur la simulation, c'est ce module de reparation automatique. je trouverai plus adapte qu il serve seulement a tester l'etat de fonctionnement. Je trouve que c'est un peu de la triche et ca casse le realisme de la simulation, cette maniere de pouvoir reparer rapidement tout a partir de composants de tout. Le challenge de survie devrait se limiter a faire des choix uniquement avec des composants qui se degradent et non reparable.
Ou alors si on peut reparer, que se soit avec de vrai composant, surtout aue sur l etabli on voit des boites de SpartParts. Ou bien il faudrait que se soit un peu plus a la Mac Gyver, genre le filtre a air marche plus, bah essayons de bricoler un truc avec ma chaussette et un elastic.

Un truc qui serait super cool aussi serait de pouvoir sortir de la capsule pour faire une reparation exterieure, mais il faudrait une combinaison spatiale, mais je verrai bien un casier avec une combi de secour et sac a dos mini regulateur pression, O2 et Co2, et une petite batterie. Je vois bien un scenario ou lorsque la pluie de meteorite arrive, on retracte l'antenne pour eviter de l'endommager, se qui affaiblie fortement le signal (soit 2 fois plus de temps). Le calme revient, je decide de deployee l antenne mais le signal reste faible... Je regarde par le hublot et je ne vois pas l'antenne deployee... pas trop de choix si je veux etre secouru soit je boost la puissance du module de communiction, soit faut allez voir ce qui se passe en exterieur. Allez on met sa combi, ah mince les niveaux de O2 et Co2 sont a 25%, mais ca devrait suffire. On entre dans le petit sas, on fait le vide et on ouvre. main droite, main gauche, j'alterne les prises pour me hisser jusqu'au module et je vois de suite le probleme, l'ouverture de l'iris est bloquee par un debris, hop ma pince et prions pour que se soit bon.

Je pars en delir, mais ca serait cool n est ce pas?
En tout cas ce jeu est deja enorme, je le recommande fortement

Se c'Ã¨ un problema un allarme scatta, se ce ne sono 3 senti suonare all'impazzata gli allarmi e nel caos potresti sbagliare e... morire male.

RecommandÃ©
1.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 mai 2022
Nice game, haven't seen anything like it. The game is pretty stressful, and you have to move quickly around in the pod to get things done.
For me it could be a bit more slow to enjoy the ride even more and have time to think it over. It is a lot of trial and error.

Before going into the pod, take whatever you can!

3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 mai 2022
The game is a great panic-stress simulator.

However, you cannot climb out the airlock and there is an invisible wall. So it loses some score because of this. I would highly suggest using a second screen to have the manual open on. It is hard to find the manual in game when there is gravity or lights.

ç”µå­äº‘ï¼ˆç”µæ¶Œï¼‰ï¼šå…¨æ¸¸æˆæœ€å‡¶é™©çš„äº‹ä»¶ï¼Œç«‹åˆ»å…³é—­ååº”å †ï¼Œå°½å¯èƒ½ä¸‹çº¿ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰ç”µæ± ç¦»çº¿ï¼Œé™¤äº†CO2å’ŒO2çš„ç³»ç»Ÿã€‚è¿™æ—¶å€™ä½ åº”è¯¥æœ‰6ä¸ªæ™®é€šç”µæ± å’Œ1ä¸ªè¶…å¤§ç”µæ± ï¼ˆä»äººå·¥é‡åŠ›æ‹†å‡ºæ¥çš„ï¼Œè¿™ç©æ„1ä¸ªé¡¶3ä¸ªï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ä¸è¦ç”¨åœ¨ç”µæ¶Œé‡Œï¼Œç‚¸ä¸€æ¬¡æ¸…ç©ºè¡€å‹éƒ½æ‹‰æ»¡äº†ï¼‰ã€‚æ¥ä¸‹æ¥ç”µæ¶Œçš„æŸå¤±ä¼šè¢«å‹åˆ¶ï¼Œä½†ä¾ç„¶ä¼šå¯¼è‡´ä¿é™©ä¸ç‚¸è£‚ï¼Œè¿™æ²¡åŠæ³•ã€‚ä½†è‡³å°‘ç”µæ± ä¿ä½äº†ï¼Œä¸ä¼šä¸€æ¬¡æ€§æ¸…ç©ºæ‰€æœ‰ç”µæ± å¯¼è‡´ç›´æ¥å»ä¸–ã€‚
ï¼ˆä¼˜åŒ–åº”å¯¹ï¼‰ï¼šå°½å¯èƒ½æ‹”æ‰æ’å¤´ï¼Œåªæœ‰ä¸»ç”µç½‘çš„è®¾å¤‡ä¼šè¢«ç”µæ¶Œæ³¢åŠå¹¶æ¸…ç©ºç”µåŠ›ï¼Œæå‰æ‹”æ‰è¦ä¾›ç”µçš„ç³»ç»Ÿå°±å¯ä»¥å®‰ç¨³çš„åº¦è¿‡ç”µå­äº‘ï¼Œä¸ä¼šå‡ºç°æ¸…ç©ºç”µæ± çš„æƒ…å†µï¼ˆä½†è¿™æ—¶é‚£äº›ä½ æ²¡æ¥å¾—åŠæ‹”æ‰çš„æ²¡é€šç”µçš„è®¾å¤‡ä¾ç„¶ä¼šç‚¸ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯ç‚¸æ’å¤´å’Œä¿é™©ä¸ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯è‡³å°‘æ‹”æ‰æ’å¤´ç”µæ± ä¾›ç”µçš„é‚£å‡ ä¸ªç³»ç»Ÿä¿è¯ä¸ä¼šå—æŸï¼‰ã€‚å®æµ‹åœ¨é¢„è­¦ï¼ˆä¸»ç”µè„‘ï¼‰åœ¨çº¿æƒ…å†µä¸‹ä½ æœ‰å……è¶³æ—¶é—´æ–­æ‰€æœ‰è®¾å¤‡çš„æ’å¤´ï¼ˆæ³¨æ„å…ˆå…³æ‰ç”µå™¨å¦åˆ™è¦è§¦ç”µçš„ï¼‰ï¼Œè¿™æ—¶å€™æ•´ä¸ªç”µå­äº‘äº‹ä»¶å…‰æ‰“é›·ï¼Œå•¥ä¹Ÿä¸å‘ç”Ÿï¼Œä¸èµ·ç«ä¸åéƒ¨ä»¶å•¥éƒ½æ²¡äº‹ï¼Œæ— å®³ç¨‹åº¦å ªæ¯”å†°éœœäº‘ã€‚
é«˜æ¸©ï¼ˆè¿‡æ’æ˜Ÿï¼‰ï¼šç«‹åˆ»å…³é—­ååº”å †ï¼Œå…¶ä»–çš„è¯åº”æ€¥ç¯å…‰å¯ä»¥ç•™ä¸‹ï¼ˆè€—ç”µå¾ˆå°ï¼‰ï¼Œäººå·¥é‡åŠ›å»ºè®®åˆ«å¼€ï¼ˆè€—ç”µè¶…çº§é«˜ä¸”æ²¡å¿…è¦ï¼Œåªæ˜¯å¤±é‡æ“ä½œéš¾ä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œä½†è¿™é‡Œä¸éœ€è¦å¤§é‡æ“ä½œï¼‰ï¼ŒCO2å’ŒO2å’Œæ¸©æ§ä¸€å®šè¦å¼€ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ åœ¨ä¸€å¼€å§‹ç«‹åˆ»å…³é—­äº†ååº”å †ï¼Œä¿ç•™æ¸©æ§ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæ•´ä¸ªäº‹ä»¶è¿‡å»çš„æ—¶å€™æ¸©åº¦åªä¼šè¾¾åˆ°37åº¦ã€‚ååº”å †ç»å¯¹ä¸èƒ½å¼€ï¼Œåªè¦å¼€äº†å°±ç­‰ç€ç…®èƒèŸ¹å§ã€‚

I've only played 4 hours but I can absolutely recommend this title! Its a bit daunting at first, you WILL feel overwhelmed at the start, but if you let yourself drown in the chaos a few times you start to get the hang of it. Highwire
0
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 mai 2022
This game does not demand superhuman memory of you, unlike some people claim. I've beaten the 25 minutes rescue mission so far and I still don't know any of the error codes by heart. ALL of the possible error codes are summarized on page 3 of the manual and even if you need to look them up every time, you have enough time for fixes.*

*Of course if you have NO understanding of the systems to begin with, you will die rather quickly. (this is expected at the beginnng). There will also be situations that seems super hectic and unfair, until you realize it wasn't about being too slow, but touching (or ignoring) the wrong systems entirely.

At this point I can often see what's wrong with a system by looking at it, rather than checking the exact code. The game world itself is the UI. For example you can see that an air filter is clogged or that the oxygen bottle is empty. Those can be fixed wihtout even looking at a monitor, and so you can greatly reduce the amount of errors that need to be checked. Some other errors can be deduced from analog tools, for example if I see the oxygen meter is in red, and the oxygen device has exactly one error, then I know it is the "oxygen low" error. If no other errors are present, it means the system runs fine and the error will disappear soon.

There's a lot of little details like this to learn and the game is a lot of fun if you like the experience of NOT knowing how something works and THEN figuring it out (while usually dying in the process, as the ultimate learning driver).

Lastly, this game can produce moments of deep peacefulness, where everything is just running fine, your only job is to exist, surrounded by machines doing their job in the endless nothingness of space.
 
Holonaut
732 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 mai 2022
My honest review.

I'm not sure if there is a clear idea on where the developers were headed with this game but the game feels clunky and the game play mechanics don't seem to work well together. there are mechanics that are never addressed like the cooling system gas and pressurization system gas. we are given a tutorial that instructs us on how to repair parts like we even have time for that lol........ we are given batteries and if you need them you obviously dont have electricity to charge them, but lets be honest if you lose power you will have lost in the time it takes for the batteries to run out, the only use is anti hypoxia.. we are given a manual that is quite frankly useless until you realize that the current run is a wipe so you look at it while waiting for your death.

i think this game would really polish up well if there was more systems that worked well together, less emphasis on the memorization of weather scenario to fix relationship, 30 or so more components with more error codes along with more time to troubleshoot consult manual and repair. this should include ways to bypass systems or connect systems together if you do not have the parts available to run each system independently ie bringing co bottle down to pressurization system if you need to repair co system etc.

final thoughts: this game is really fun and if you are looking for a wacky reflex driven game then this is a great pick! it is an experience that is worth playing through and hopefully it gets better and the devs find a way to make the systems compliment each other rather than a handful of mechanics stuffed in a box together.

483 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 mai 2022
Tin Can is a cool space escape pod simulator that challenges you to keep a rickety old escape pod functioning long enough to get rescued, or as long as you can. In my opinion, it lacks replay value, but the time that you do get is pretty fun. The systems onboard the escape pod have a good balance of accessibility and complexity, with just enough realism to make it interesting but not so much as to make it tedious.

The main challenge on board the pod comes from five or so different "space weather" events that heat up the pod, freeze it, fry the circuits, break things, and warp gravity and pressure. With good preparation and an understanding of the pod's systems you can usually get through most of them without any harm.

In the original release, it was somewhat panned for apparently frantic and futile gameplay that always ends in death. Many of the negative reviews are based on it, and I wouldn't have enjoyed it much either. The developer responded by relaxing the pacing and adding a rescue mode that challenges you to survive long enough to get rescued, plus challenge modes that put you in tricky (and sometimes silly) situations with a clear goal to accomplish. I like these new game modes. Nonetheless the game still starts with a 60-second mad dash to grab as many parts as you can before the ship explodes, injecting a frantic, click-as-fast-as-you-can beginning into what I wish was more of a pure strategy and simulation game. It's not too bad, though, once you learn which things you need to grab and where they are. The rescue mode is also where you unlock new parts that you can bring with you.

What I believe to be the original game mode is preserved as the "ranking" mode where you just try to survive as long as you can. It's not possible to survive indefinitely because asteroids will randomly hit the pod and damage it, breaking systems and causing it to leak air. You can patch the leaks and repair the damage, but you lose some nonrenewable resources every time. Some people may not like the lack of an "endless" mode, but I suppose it's a good thing. I'm not much interested in the ranking mode because it's ultimately futile, with every playthrough ending in death. Some people may enjoy the challenge of competing on the leaderboards though, and almost all the achievements are obtained in ranking mode.

All in all, I suppose the game has about 9 hours' worth of gameplay in it, or more if you really spend a lot of time in ranking mode. I'm not sure it's worth $20, but I'm glad to support this small studio in their first game. I also want to see more games like this.
 
Adam

as it is get it on sale. it's like tech support or diagnosing your pc to the umpteenth degree. if trying to solve technical problems while you lose gravity and are slowly dying of carbon dioxide poisoning doesnt sound like something that would interest you steer clear, but the fun of learning the ropes and mitigating problems while you try to postpone the inevitable demise of your tin can cannot be denied. it's not for everyone, but especially at a sales price it's an unforgettable experience
