jamster818
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 mai 2022
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Overview
Incredibly fun and stressful game about making sure everything you need to survive in space works just long enough for you to be rescued, the time taken for your rescue increasing more and more through each mission, each mission also unlocking more things for you to worry about as you go along.
Would highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys puzzle/learning games, and games that are more grounded in reality.

Pros
â€¢ The game does an excellent job of teaching you how to play, without 'baby-proofing' everything and making you walk through a virtual simon-says game. Even though some aspects of the tutorial won't be used until much later into the game, it's useful to give it to you all upfront.
â€¢ Excellently decision 'missions' that challenge you every step of the way. Each mission has distinct sections of events that happen, and given enough time you will be able to memorize what will happen at which stage, but nothing is in no-way pre-programmed to fail and it's a new challenge every time.
â€¢ Gathering materials at the start adds a certain level of RNG if you'd like to put it that way that's similar to the game "60 Seconds!" and is both extremely rewarding if you pick the right materials and extremely punishing if you don't.
â€¢ The Zero-Gravity aspect of the game is incredibly well created when the artificial gravity runs out, and is a genuine extra challenge, forcing yourself to maneuver through a game you'd never think to do otherwise.
â€¢ The ties to real spaceship functions is amazing. Sure not every single detail is replicated but the basic functions of how humans can survive in space currently is replicated awesomely, without resorting to too much sci-fi. The atmosphere and temperature systems are notable examples of this.
â€¢ Indescribable fun. That's about as best of a way to put it. You're in a near constant state of panic, fighting the elements and whatever â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ the universe throws at you, and knowing you're on the brink of certain death makes you fight ever harder.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥
â€¢ Even though it's "official finished" there are still a lot of crashes that happen for seemingly no reason. In my 3 hours of playing I experienced about 5 crashes, about half popped up as a Unity error and the other half was a hard application crash. Thankfully it didn't happen 3 seconds after I was about to be rescued but it's still noteworthy.
â€¢ The game doesn't explain that you have actually 2 hands, one for each mouse button and they genuinely act like 2 hands. It would be a massive Pro for excellent game design in a way that really makes you think outside of the box but unfortunately the game makes no effort to tell you this even in passing and you need to rely on you just figuring it out. It's almost unfathomable how you could play this game without the option to hold 2 things at once.
â€¢ For all the good the tutorial has, the game completely fails to mention how to repair or service the artificial gravity generator, fails to explain certain elements like the battery re-charger and how those systems all integrate into the workings of the ship, etc. There will be a lot of shouty "WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO, I DON'T KNOW HOW TO FIX THIS" moments but I guess thats all part of the experience!

Final Verdict
Brilliant and unique game concept and I would love to see the developers address the issues I've highlighted above, and keep on expanding the game. 8/10 fix the bugs please :)
 
CmdData

- D'apparence complexe, mais en faite se relÃ¨ve en faite trÃ¨s simple.

Finalement le pire ennemie c'est l'usure des composants poussant Ã  cannibaliser les systÃ¨mes les moins essentiels jusqu'au plus essentiels nous conduisant irrÃ©mÃ©diablement jusqu'Ã  la mort.

- Je m'attendais vraiment Ã  avoir un jeux avec une durÃ©e de vie trÃ¨s court (parce que l'ont fait vite le tours ) et final ce n'est absolument pas le cas, j'ai actuellement 15 heures de jeux et encore de nombreuses heures m'attendent.

- points nÃ©gatives: Le jeux souffre de bugs trÃ¨s chiant comme les bugs de collisions et de ciblages d'objets, heureusement ont peux plus ou moins les apprivoiser.

Really interesting concept!
The goal is to survive in an (old) escape pod, with limited resources and different events happening.
The basic physics make sense (i.e. Life support O2, CO2, etc). Of course, there is oversimplication in many parts, to keep this enjoyable.
I would highly recommend this due to the interesting concept and good-enough implementation.

Ramo Rua
275 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
9.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 mai 2022
Fun, frantic, and infinitely re-playable. As you continue to play the game the more you can recognize certain error codes and react accordingly, prioritize tasks, and organize yourself. Some have said if you have to consult the manual that you have already lost. This isn't necessarily true, but some will start to click and find yourself remembering the codes (on battery, filter dirty, ect). The game will throw events at you where things can go haywire and you will need to remain active and prepare ahead of time for the event. The game doesn't explicitly tell you this outright how to handle said events and may take some trial and error. Thankfully, the in-game tips on death screens provide useful info. (However holding things with two hands was a game changer and would've loved to know sooner lol)

On your first dozen or more games you may find yourself overwhelmed and stressed, but as you get conformable with the games systems and identify which systems to prioritize, it gets easier and less stressful. Rewarding for those who stick with it and take the time to learn. I can absolutely recommend this game who like a challenging experience.
 
Arachanoid
164 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
9.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 mai 2022
While I've only played for six hours I've gone through all the main "campaign" missions, those that give you the challenge of surviving in your escape pod for increasingly lengthening time till you are rescued. And I can confirm that this game is a lot of fun. It is really a failure simulator, like those used by astronauts to train for space flight. The player has to respond to an emergency, diagnose the problem and implement a fix, all while time or oxygen or something is running out.

There is nothing illogical about the game, which makes it all the more enjoyable. While the failures are random, they are random in a logical way. For instance, a small asteroid hits your spaceship. The shock and vibration causes a failure. The component(s) that failed might be random, but the occurrence of the failure is a logical outcome of the collision.

There are a number of events in the game that can cause emergencies so there is a variety of actions you'll end up taking. And even without the events there are things you need to do periodically to keep your ship and yourself alive and healthy. And it all feels logical.

The devs have been very supportive during Early Access and they are on Discord answering questions and taking suggestions. It's always good to support devs that are so receptive and willing to work with their fans.

For the price, and especially for the initial release discount, the game is very much worth the price.
 
jztemple

PRESSURE! Can you handle it?
Use every single damned synapse of your huge brain to survive mate. From EM storms frying your whole pod's systems to shrapnel breaching the hull, this game is a true test to your skills and knowledge.
9/10!

957 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
5.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 mai 2022
So far I've completed the first two levels of the "Rescue" game mode, which require you to survive for incrementally longer periods of time before being rescued. I also did the first challenge scenario, in which the escape pod has only one available power switch to use and an electrical storm threatening to break all your equipment or start fires. There is a tutorial to get you started before you play, but the game does not hold your hand beyond that. And honestly, I love it. It took me a few tries on each of the levels I played before I figured out how to proceed successfully, and had a lot of fun along the way. Looking forward to playing more levels and seeing what may be added to the game in the future.

It's a niche, but if you like the niche it's gold.
Every play one of those mechic simulator games? I'd played mech mechanic simulator before, but one of the things it was missing was that sense of urgency, there's no pressure.

Well once you start missing pressure in your escape pod you get that rushed feeling back. It's a fun little game if you're into the niche, and I recommend at least trying the demo if your interest is at all piqued.

It's funny but not playable in VR at the moment.
I hope this will get fixed but I dont think so. Developers call it a feature.

But it's still a very good non-VR-game

Awawiwous
1
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 fÃ©vrier 2022
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Best VR "Idiot box" I've ever been in! This game will make you sweat, think, and overload your decision making ability!

You are half way through troubleshooting your oxygen generator when somewhere in the back of your mind, the hissing noise finally registers as a puncture in your little Tin Can. You drop what you are doing, snag the goop gun, and frantically begin searching for the leak. It's in your bunk. Awkward angle, long reach, goop applied! Congratulations, you've solved problem #57!

Now where did you put that power inverter?

Oh no, you are almost out of air! Release some O2 while you search for that part. Quick, you left the battery charger plugged in too long and it caught fire!

Lot's of little bugs i'm sure they will patch soon. If you are a spaceflight/engineering nerd, this is the idiot box for you!

10/10, can't wait to see new updates!
 
spartan7-11
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
12.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 janvier 2022
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Note: This review is for PC, not VR.

Pros:
Proper systems-oriented gameplay
Really well executed hard sci-fi aesthetic
Makes me feel like an astronaut
It got almost all the science right, and what it didn't was mostly done for the sake of gameplay
Graphics are pretty nice

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
1 event in particular behaves in a manner beyond science
There's only 6 events, so it doesn't take long for you to see them all
The events are chosen at random, so sometimes you'll be struggling to fix everything in time and other times you'll find yourself waiting for something to happen

Good news for the future:
The devs have stated they want to rework the events, and agree that the weird one doesn't really behave properly.
The devs have an active presence on the discord server and seem committed to improving the game

Overall, I recommend it to anybody who likes space, physics, and likes the idea of desperately trying to fix the machines that keep you alive

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

It's a great game for optimizing freaks. You'll need to learn very strict connections between temperature, pressure, oxygen and carbon dioxide content in the air, power available, alarm codes and all the other things just to be able to prevent yourself from dying within minutes in constantly changing enviorment of your small tin can. Nice game to just start from time to time and try to survive through at least one event. I hope that authors will add some new capsule with different enviormental rules.

0
RecommandÃ©
81.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 octobre 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Where to begin. I am always on the look out for new games that involve a close theme to space ( i love space). One day I came across Tin Can. I have never made it to the end if there is an end but its a constant challenge to see if you have the skills to last longer and longer. It's a simplistic yet complex game all in one. it challenges you to think on your feet. curse at yourself for doing something stupid, just all around fun. I would recommend this game to anyone who like to challenge them self's and well likes a survival game without a grind. While the game is in early access The developers are in constant communication with players about bugs to be fixed, suggestions to add or remove in game. Unlike other games they are very involved with the fan base and that's on a whole other level. With game play being fun but challenging, the constant addition of new features / fixes. to the involvement of the developers with there fan base to get ideas, fix bugs, or even generic discussion I would absolutely recommend this game! Oh and there will be a multiplayer so there is that too.

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

I'm actually not really sure how to feel about this game. I mean, I do love the concept. The game runs smooth and looks great. The problem is, is that the game seems... I don't know how to say it. It's like the game is just too much when it comes to damage. Like you get about 1min to fix an issue when in the real world most of these issues are give more if not hours. One danger after another, a meteor storm. Can it just be like, I don't know a random meteor that hits instead of thousands? Like I feel like it could have so many real life issues rather than these other things. Maybe also make it where you can go to survive days on food rations, sleep and so on. I don't, I'm just a weirdo. I'd pretty much just recommend this game if its on sale.

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 septembre 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

A game about trying to survive with limited resources. Events happen, something happens to the systems in your pod, and it's your job to fix it while thumbing through a manual in the dark, a flashlight with limited battery between your teeth as you look back and forth between the monitor and user manual, trying to find the specific error code that you are facing. It's really fun, though sometimes your circumstances can be really unreasonable. Still, a good game.

EDIT: They've made the game a lot easier by giving you a completed system at the start. It's much easier now!
 
Templar Headless
246 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
53.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 septembre 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

I've never found a game that captures the desire to operate complicated machinery manage complex systems better than this game! It's a perfect blend of complexity in principle without becoming so complex that you need a manual to operate anything (there is an in-game manual, but once you learn the ropes it becomes less necessary) There's no feeling quite like the pride of surviving an insane disaster where everything burns down around you and pulling everything back together to be ready for the next disaster.

All in all, an incredibly fun game that scratches an itch that no other game will. Definitely buy!

RecommandÃ©
9.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 juillet 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Ever since I was a kid I've always play pretended to be in a spaceship and have to troubleshoot things and act like I was keeping the ship from exploding. As I grew up, I've always wanted to make or play a game where you have to click buttons and flip levers to fix highly technical things. Then there was a mobile game that came out called Space Team that was the closest thing to full filling my urge to keep a ship alive, but I didn't have friends that enjoyed playing it together. Now, after all these years, a game to live up to my expectations and meet my every need to satisfy the kid inside me; TIN CAN!!!! So much freaking yessssss. This game is so insanely fun and fast paced to keep me busy and thinking on my feet (or in anti-gravity). Can't wait for multiplayer mode to come out, but been playing with a friend and pretending we are a tech support trying to help and figure things out. Can't wait to see what else the developer have in mind to make this game even better than what it is!
 
YautjaDreads
19 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 juillet 2021
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Won this game in a giveaway. Its a fun game once you understand what each component is for and identifying it. the sirens get my heart racing and when the guy in game couldn't breath, I could barely either. This is a testament to the immersion of the scenario!

Keeping thing running is rewarding in that you can maintain survival and the various "events" are each pretty unique.

The decision to certain parts to repair other parts is not an easy one as it is far more difficult to repair an item than to destroy it for parts. This still needs some balance though the core idea is really good.

I would hope for the following changes to make this game even better:

1. Tutorial with voice more queued highlighting and/or pointers when highlights aren't in view
2. The ability to play this in VR would be ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!
3. Probably a way to win (not just survive) but this can wait until this game is truly released.
 
THE PING

RecommandÃ©
57.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juin 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Stressful in a fun way. The point of desperation is the best part of the game.

System components and their functions create the game's depth and they're pretty simple.

There are multiple ways to solve problem in this game and because of that it opens a lot of decision making possibilities the player would have to consider.

The playground is small but trust me later on everything feels so far especially if you're in panic.

The devs are active and listening to feedback as well as discord members would answer inquiries.
For beginners, knowing the different parts and what they do would definitely improve your enjoyment of the game.

macg4dave

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
6.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 avril 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

You are in a life pod after a disaster hurdling through space, each individual component is simulated and you have one job, survive. You will need to make difficult decisions, find root cause of various issues by reading the manual and looking up error codes, swap and repair parts, and plan ahead to survive as long as possible. You may need to borrow from less critical systems (making them non-functional) to fix the most critical problems. Great game if you like detailed simulations in space and learning systems.

Will to live regressing
1
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1
RecommandÃ©
3.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 mars 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

I have been waiting for a space game to (sort of) replicate the feeling of being trapped in space much like Apollo 13. You are locked in a metal box with finite resources, each being precious and necessary for your survival, but sacrifices must be made. The openness of being able to solve some problems and the experimentation of other solutions and using your own methods to figure out how to survive an EMP storm or a blazing inferno outside your pod window is extremely rewarding. The game has alot of potential and I cant see the devs keeping it at $15 for a long time, so I would pick it up now if I were you. The game is very unforgiving but is a hell of a lot of fun.
 
Arizona Ranger

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 mars 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

A great game that can only get better.
1 the variety of parts and the requirements of different systems present interesting options.
You don't need to put a fuse in a circuit but this might be the death of you.
If you are running a low powered system entirely off battery power it does not need a power connector, transformer, or fuse.
2 The end of each run becomes a compromise on all systems.
The central computer might save huge amounts of time by simply telling you what is wrong with each system but it's full of valuable parts you WILL require elsewhere. Break out the manual you're going to need it late game.
3 The Sandbox modes allows you to pick and choose when and what events you want to happen. It's a good way to learn the game without the constant time pressure.
4 I see it mentioned a lot the game doesn't hold your hand and the tutorial doesn't prepare you for all situations...Ok yes that is true but this is the kind of game where you go searching for the information you need.
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXA4I5WQ8TX_0hLnBbcZrIQ
I personally found this the best source of information. His videos are experienced, the presentation is neat on the quality of information is high. He will explain different phenomena and faults as well as show how to address them.
Sincerely Bane882266
 
Bane882266
246 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 fÃ©vrier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

I haven't played a lot, and am definitely gonna give it a few more goes before I make my final assessment.

this game is great for what it's trying to do... except when RNG hates you.

so far I've had 3 attempts
first I died because I didn't know what I was doing in the first 5 minutes
second I died because I had trouble finding where things were and getting used to the layout
third time I died after 12+ minutes because of complete RNG

the first and second times are expected in a game like this so I was fully prepared for that as I got better
but this third attempt was just a letdown. I was doing really well, had things going nicely, until in the matter of 3 minutes EVERY SINGLE ONE of my fuses broke, half my power transmitters broke and my CO2 scrubbers just STOPPED without any errors.
with no way to reliably repair any parts (yes there is the repair machine but you have to break other parts to get the stuff you need and you use more than you get so it's a losing battle no matter what)
no way to generate any resource, and nothing you can do with a dead battery when in an ice nebula...
it's just RNG that determines your fate, sure, a bit of skill can carry you a few minutes further, but when every single fuse breaks as you're going through an ice nebula, your power is off, gravity is off, and literally nothing works with no way to fix anything, it's game over no matter what.

as an idea this is amazing
â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ RNG tho

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 fÃ©vrier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

This is a great little game, that really gets across what I imagine a crisis in a little orbiting box millions of miles from anywhere might feel like.

No "health bars"
No "oxygen bars"
No real idea of how to fix things.

All you have is some gauges, a slightly retro computer interface, a trunkful of spare parts and an instruction manual. The goal? Survive as long as you can. Maybe you'll even get rescued, but probably not.

Great fun either alone or with friends reading the manual for you.

This thing will make you panic like a hamster trapped in a trash can, which you essentially are as you desperately scavenge your environment for parts. 1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
2.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 janvier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Fantastic game! It feels like I'm on Apollo 13 (except for the artificial gravity, but I'm ok with that)! It even has buzzers and alarms and flashing lights! You have to make difficult decisions about what you're willing to sacrifice in order to barely scrape by, which ultimately just delays your inevitable doom. It gives you the sort of claustrophobia and anxiety you get from all the best sci-fi space dramas! My only complaint is that the repair station works a bit too much like magic which makes it feel a little out of place.

73 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
20.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 janvier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

This is a puzzle game with an incredible twist!! So many different problems can impact a scenario with varying complexities. Some are simple to solve others compound on other problems. You'll not need any caffeine to play this game - the game has it in it! A lot of opportunities here to think outside the box, be resourceful, and conservative. With a nuclear reactor, you have near unlimited power, but circuits can still get overloaded causing the reactor to shutdown. If your batteries are dead, what's going to pump O2 into the air for you? Think fast and you'll survive!

Don't worry everybody dies in the tutorial.
 
d-dubs
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 janvier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Each run is a puzzle about what parts you want to sacrifice for your survival. There is currently no 'end' to the game besides your eventual demise but thats really not what this game is about. This is a survival game in the purest sense, you're not going to be saved and you know that. You will not reach a point of stability in this game like you do with other survival games and that is whats good about it, it leaves you no way out. Now currently the game is a little bare but the devs have been making good progress on this game(there is plans for multiplayer and custom pods) so I feel confident this game wont be a permanent EA game like most people fear. Now in terms of gameplay I would say that if you are not at least a little tech savy or not very good at critical thinking you may dislike this game as its basis revolves around parts breaking and solutions be made. At the very least this game is worth a wishlisting, its future is bright.
 
KillWill
1,024 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 janvier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

*This review is subject to change the more I play this game/the more updates are released*

What I like about this game is its dedication to realism. The entire premise of the game is intriguing and immediately piqued my curiosity. I like space and I like problem solving, so this game was a no-brainer for me.

I think the biggest problem with this game is that the learning curve is incredibly--almost insurmountably--steep. After my first few attempts at survival crashed around the 10 minute mark, I decided to try the tutorial out...only to run into the exact same roadblocks. I was surprised to learn how easy it was for one to die *in the tutorial*. I often found the hints in the tutorial to be useless. "This thing is broken, you should fix it," isn't exactly helpful. I found myself in situations where the tutorial would prompt me that some system was malfunctioning, but upon inspecting it I had no way of really determining what exactly the problem was. I'd consult the manual, and while it seemed helpful for identifying problem, it also seemed useless when it came to suggestions on how to fix them. Maybe that's on me. Maybe I breezed over something or skipped something in my haste.

I'm not looking for hand-holding or coddling, certainly not during gameplay. But I would suggest that perhaps the tutorial could be somewhat more forgiving and edifying.

I suppose that's really the crux of the problem, though. Part of the thrill and stress of the gameplay is in learning as you go and having to solve problems on the fly. That all comes back to the dedication to realism, which is admirable and oddly enough, addicting. But there's a fine line between challenging and annoyingly frustrating.

I plan on continuing to play this game, and I'm hopeful that I'll start figuring it out, or discover that I missed some important detail that opens up more of the game to me. I'd definitely recommend giving it a try.
 
Un dÃ©veloppeur ou une dÃ©veloppeuse a rÃ©pondu Ã  cette Ã©valuation

RecommandÃ©
1.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 janvier 2021
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

This game has a ton of potential, though it could probably benefit from even a small amount of additional tutorialization. It throws you in right away with only a manual for help and you're left to your own intuition to figure out how things work or what things mean and how to fix them. However the manual basically just lists what things are and what functions they have and what error codes mean, and not how to fix or prevent any of said errors. Might make some people bounce off it if it's not clear what even is going wrong. Also, and this is just my opinion, it would be great in VR especially since it uses a two hands holding things system, but that'd just be an extra.

133 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
3.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 dÃ©cembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Do you like life? Do you like surviving to the next day? Then frig off this game ain't for you. just kidding please stay, i'm lonely.

Tin Can is a fantastic game about surviving in a slowly deteriorating escape pod which you have to maintain in order to survive. You'll have to make sacrifices and prioritize what you absolutely need and what you can cannibalize. There are also event's you'll have to survive, for example, flying through an asteroid field and hoping your reactor doesn't die.

All in all, a fantastic game, well worth the money!

10/10 It's ok - IGN
 
Jack Hood
490 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 dÃ©cembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

GRAPHICS + CONTROLS
-----------------------------
The Visuals are quite impressive, Starting with the loading screen with a clean finish moving onto the Menu, The menu could look better [Cleaner more compact] But none the less gets the job done, In game is quite stunning with visuals outside your 'Pod's window needing more 'Space' Esc feel.

Controls are quite simple for a complex game, In this case thats GOOD! Less time to worry about what button to start up the reactor and more to worry about the fact you forget coolent failed 2 minutes ago!

Active Development
------------------------
Things are quite active, Both on the game and on the games Discord, No the kind of interactivity you get often.

5/5
-----
Its just so involving and focusing that you love it!

DIFFICULT
-----------
Its not easy. Not meant to. However your thrown right on in, Be it Oxygen failure Power problems and more, Many ways to die and lots of way to try. Hard to elaborate on this, Amazing experience however.

An extremely promising game with an active developer who listens to the demands of the community. At the moment it is still pretty raw, but fully playable without game breaking bugs.

RecommandÃ©
3.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

This game is so simple at its' core, but a lot of fun to play. The stress of the situation is relentless and you are essentially on a losing battle stuck in a dying lifeboat. The main goal is beating your longest survival time. Having said that, there is plenty of difference in each play through to stop you getting bored, and I like the lack of any kind of assistance other than your trusty manual. I would definitely recommend trying this game now and join the excellent community to help fund and shape this game. The roadmap sounds quite exciting.

8.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Dying repeatedly is usually a bad experience in a game.

It's the opposite in this case.


The content is relatively small at the moment which leads for repetitive-feeling playthroughs.
That being said there's enough variety and challenge in the game to keep you wanting to try and try again, hoping to get it right each time and get just a little better every time. Haven't had this much fun dying in a while. Lost count how many times I grabbed a processor before turning off a machine and getting electrocuted and yelling at myself "NO! You know better than that!" Super excited for what the future has for this game.

There's a satisfying pressure curve that let's you think, "I've got this, no problem." Then it starts to get devious. Before long you're scavenging things, making compromises, and juggling chainsaws to keep the show rolling as you begin to pass out while feverishly flipping through the manual to figure out why the Atomic pile has ceased to function. This is already a VERY playable game. There's amazing potential here and the Dev has already done some great work here.

Diciamo che all'inizio ero scettico pensando che sarebbe stato un qualcosa di impossibile da gestire, per soli intenditori ma invece il gioco presenta una curva di apprendimento abbastanza facile in questa sua primissima versione dovuta forse al fatto che i componenti e le meccaniche sono ancora ridotte. Diciamo che in 20 minuti saprete piÃ¹ o meno tirare avanti per circa 15 minuti minuti nello spazio remoto....

E poi?

E poi esploderete per la pressione, morirete assiderati, bruciati, asfissiati, folgorati e chi piÃ¹ ne ha piÃ¹ ne metta. Ho da subito messo in pratica il mio lato sadico rimuovendo il processore dal reattore principale per vedere a quanto riuscivo a farlo andare prima che esplodesse... diciamo che non sono mai arrivato a quel punto, venivo cotto prima per la temperatura elevata.

Lo consiglio assolutamente perchÃ¨ il team di sviluppo si presenta molto attivo e da subito al lavoro per risolvere eventuali problemi al lancio ed implementare idee anche suggerite dalla stessa community.

Volete morire male? Avere quella stizza del non sapere quanto ancora potrete ritenervi al sicuro?

Allora abbandonate la vostra astronave in una capsula di salvataggio fabbricata per essere la vostra tomba spaziale!

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Tin Can is for now an early access game but is has a very high potential.
Most of the features needed to have fun in a hardcore survival game set in a space survival raft are already there. Personally, I enjoyed playing directly in hardcore and experiment as a regular guy jumping in a badly crafted vehicule where every components of the machines never stop breaking down. Tin Can is really an interesting game when you learn how to play it the hard way.
I'd advise you to live the neverending dance of stress and relaxation that happens while you play AGAINST the game to survive.
Buy it, beat it, be the best on the leaderboard !
 
be not afraid
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
15.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

What a game.

Went for it honestly because I both love planes, spacecrafts and IT, haven't been deceived.
Just go for it, it is totally worth it (about 10 bucks) and will provide you way more hours of gameplay than you think.

The systems ain't that complex, but the redundancy of them coupled with the panel of different breakdowns makes it totally different and complicated to handle every time.

The more you play, the more you will understand how it works, how to deal with breakdowns, what to prioritise...

This game is endless, really really looking forward the next update.

A big up to the dev who works alone on this gem.
 
Sev Ash'amur
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Anxiety inducing, supremely confusing, unforgiving and sometimes downright cruel, but quite a good time when you wind up saving yourself on the brink of death. This game takes time and effort to play effectively. Learning how everything works and what to scrap is a sort of brick wall on your first play through. Playing around in sandbox is almost a necessity as you can easily cause a major malfunction in one system by trying to fix a minor problem in another. It's a unique game that SCREAMS for VR. I haven't dug into the discord, but I hope there is some kind of VR support planned in the future. The dev has quite a game on their hands and I am really excited about what will come to this game in the future. Support this dev and buy the game.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

First time playing a game of this type, and was quite impressed. It takes a lot of getting used to at first, but that general confusion is part of the game's atmosphere, I think. Intricate technical components and routing, substitutions for all the systems. For a rather static, closed environment, it achieves a lot of scenarios and a sense of anxiety throughout the game. Would like to see some other competitive aspects rather than just a leader board of how long you stay alive. The controls definitely work best with a mouse. The keyboard layout was a bit cumbersome for me.

MasterP'sNICECREAM
727 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
9.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 novembre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Its a simulation of flying through space on a poorly made soviet era space
vehicle made by a gang of drunkards for bottom dollar prices on friday the 13th.

If you like taking stuff apart and fixing it, getting intimate with the innards of
a space vehicle as if your life depended on it, then give it a try.

Its very much roguelite-esque in that you will die (sooner rather than later) with
the idea that you'll get better and faster each time, eventually surviving longer
and longer (in this current EA release version)

It is an early access title at the time of this writing, so the only real goal is to keep
the craft functional by any means needed, scavenging from other systems on the craft
is a must to survive, and you'll likely be a corpse-cicle within 15 minutes or less.

Its addictive and fun. Give it a try, i'd recommend it.
 
nerdistmonk

RecommandÃ©
54.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 31 octobre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Despite being only a day old, it has some of the best replayability of any game like this. You will die. A lot. What brings you back in is trying to to better next time. Figuring out what went wrong is half the battle, and not everyone likes dying to something they don't understand, not everyone is willing to put in the effort and read a 30 page manual to last longer than 10 minutes, but I assure you that investing in learning the mechanics is rewarding.

Edit: Yeah its still good and the community is nonstop active will the dev(s) (new people on the team) being the most down to earth ive ever seen

If you don't like it, refund it. 2 hours is not enough time to see everything, but it is enough to get the feel for the game. It is incredibly fun as it is with more content planned in the near future, with consistent major updates each month.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 31 octobre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Awesome game. It's great to try to figure out how the heck you have to survive with, essentially, nothing. You have to cannibalize parts, swap pieces constantly, and try to figure out how to not suffocate/hyperthermia/implosion/pressure explosion/ co2 poisoning, etc.

Youll die a lot. But I love this.
 
Robthebob

RecommandÃ©
10.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 octobre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

Amazing. What an absolutely amazing puzzle game. You'll tear apart a retro life support pod in an effort to keep it flying, juggling systems and making sacrifices as you scramble to monitor it all. You'll become increasingly desperate as system after system fails, and make compromises to keep yourself going. And eventually, entropy catches up and sucks to be you.

For any fans of space, engineering, puzzle, time management, and problem solving games, this is a must play. Amazing bones in place, the game is worth the price right now. The developers have been very communicative and sound like they've got a lot planned. I cannot wait to see what else is in store.
 
izawwlgood

RecommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 octobre 2020
Avis donnÃ© pendant l'accÃ¨s anticipÃ©

This game is exactly what I wanted after looking at the trailer.

Logical problem solving to figure out what's wrong? Check
Modular systems that allow/force you to make interesting decisions about what needs to work? Check
Figuring out problems in layers, so each new realization unlocks more ways to survive? Check
(Like, realizing that if something breaks and it doesn't have a monitor, you can check the parts by swapping it with a machine that DOES have a monitor)

Every time I see someone open some kind of technical drawer in a game trailer I hope that finding and repairing parts will be a big gameplay element, and until now I've been very disappointed. But this game actually fulfills that wish.
 
Koriar

Fun game, although still in its early stage. Currently lacks variance and lacks options (No audio options, game options). The concept is great - reminds me of Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes - we just need more content.

I have played through this a few times now and so far i seem to be have top faced different situations in each time. I will say that i can be a tense experience when you have alarms sounding all around and you cant see as your lights no longer work.

I think this game is well worth the price even though it is in early access some thing i have notice as well is that the dev has been pretty active on the discord group.

Oh one last thing try a party game with a friend. I found at lot of fun and we are still talking after he was response for my end!
